story:
CONGRATULATIONS BODYSURFERS!!!   103%!!!!
WE HIT OUR GOAL OF $18,000 AND CONTRIBUTIONS ARE STILL ROLLING IN!
THERE STILL ARE AMAZING PERKS AVAILABLE AND AS A BONUS WE ADDED A FOUNDER PACKAGE TO ALL PERKS OVER $100!
MAHALO FROM KAHA NALU HAWAII!


http://vimeo.com/107565297

***KAHA NALU HAWAII UPDATE***

Tuesday, September 30th, 2014

With 7 days left we are nearing our goal but could use a big push to get us there.

Please let everyone you know about our Kaha Nalu Hawaii indiegogo campaign.

MAHALO FOR THE SUPPORT

MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 22, 2014


Kaha Nalu Hawaii is committed to redesigning the antiquated 'bathing-suit' as you know it.  We will introduce a line of 3 different types of suits with our first being a speedsuit which will combine olympic technology and the industry's current boardshorts.

We are offering these on a limited prototype basis.  You will be riding what our team riders wear.

*All other perks will be available November 2014.
*Founder Package included
*WTSGM DVD included.
*International shipping add $15



TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 16, 2014
Kaha Nalu Hawaii is ecstatic to announce that we have recruited one of the industry's top designers with one goal in mind...to create the ultimate bodysurfing speedtrunks line.
Until now, all surf trunks have been created with the board-surfer in mind.  We love hanging out in these trunks, but try to swim and catch waves in them for a few hours and they will leave you rashed up and destroyed.

These are this year's best selling surf trunks according to SIMA (Surf Industry Manufacturers Association).  If you notice, not a lot has changed since this 1973 ad below.

Yes, better materials are currently being utilized, but nothing has changed in the design which would further enhance bodysurfing performance or comfort.
Kaha Nalu Hawaii is working on a breakthrough design that will change the market forever.  In fact, we will completely revolutionize the way you even look at a tradition "bathing suit."
Gone will be the days of walking like a crab and fearing the hot shower.  Anybody who bodysurfs knows exactly what I am talking about.
Using, top-tier technology, materials and sustainable production practices, Kaha Nalu Hawaii will be introducing our line of speed trunks in 2015.  We believe, our trunks will even become the first choice of board-surfers as well.  Welcome to the paradigm shift.
Mahalo and please share this campaign with your friends.


Our Story

Aloha, my name is Sean Enoka and I am a bodysurfer from Oahu and founder of Kaha Nalu Hawaii.  Bodysurfing is the art of riding a wave without the assistance of any buoyant device such as a surfboard or bodyboard and is the traditional Hawaiian activity of Kaha Nalu.  I welcome you all to the Kaha Nalu Hawaii community and want to let you know more about what we have planned.


Our campaign goal is to finance the launch of Kaha Nalu Hawaii - a bodysurfing brand that truly represents our passion and drive towards the art of Kaha Nalu and also celebrates our roots of the Hawaiian lifestyle.  We are not only proud that Hawaii is home to some of best bodysurfing on the planet but also the tremendous amount of aloha that our community generates and shares with the world.  With these two factors being our backbone, Kaha Nalu Hawaii will focus on performance and style in our design to create equipment, apparel, and clothing that will be at the forefront of the bodysurfing experience while instilling positivity into your local community and those around you for generations to come.

This project is special to me because there is nothing really out there for bodysurfers.  For years I've wished that there were someplace that we could turn, to get products and information that are just for us, but our sport is often overlooked by the surf industry and has not quite gotten there yet.  This is where we come in and my goal is to create a brand to help spread the Hawaiian stoke, and perpetuate Hawaiian Culture through Kaha Nalu, and bring together the Bodysurfing Ohana.  

We are building the Kaha Nalu Hawaii website geared to launch our brand to the global bodysurfing community.   We have been conducting extensive research and design and on all the products currently on the market and know that we can improve upon them.  The majority of equipment available worldwide is either geared towards surfing and snorkeling, outdated, poor quality and craftsmanship or simply designed by non-bodysurfers.  Our goal is for Kaha Nalu Hawaii to be a complete bodysurfing brand start to finish offering only the finest gear.  We are currently consulting with lead industry designers and the best wave-riders in the world to create a full line of premium bodysurfing-focused products.  Kaha Nalu Hawaii will initiate production on everything from trunks, rashguards, swim fins, to handplanes, wetsuits and clothing.  Simply put, Kaha Nalu Hawaii will create original products to raise your standards in regards to your bodysurfing equipment.

By contributing to our campaign, you are helping us progress the art and are getting in on the ground level of a grass-roots movement of a local hawaiian business that could grow into the first international bodysurfing brand ever!

What We Need & What You Get

With our Indiegogo campaign we are attempting to create a spark in the global bodysurfing community that will hopefully lead to a huge fire.  We normally have problems with hand-outs unless they are for a really good cause.  And yes, this happens to be a great cause and you get some really cool rewards in return in addition to our deepest gratitude.  Our initial goal of raising $18,000 is to merely cover all start-up costs and begin limited run productions until we get a stronger foothold.  Our dream goal is to raise closer to $48,000 but we are willing to work slowly and diligently for as long as it takes.  We really want to start off on the right foot and if we do exceed our goal, then we have some exciting plans to take it to the next level but first let's talk about our reward system so many graciously donated to and what you get for your hard-earned money you supported Kaha Nalu Hawaii with. 


Out of respect, we reached out to many bodysurfing legends and explained our reasoning and goals for Kaha Nalu Hawaii and to see if we were in the right track.  Remarkably, every single one came back in utter support.  In fact, they all offered up amazing donations for the bodysurfing community.  So whether you are the greatest bodysurfer of all-time or a nervous grom about to go for their first swim , we thank you in all advance.  We cannot make this possible without everybody's support and we will recognize and reward all of our backers, regardless of donation amount.  Please remember, we tried to figure out a breakdown that will stoke out all supporter yet still raise as much funds as we can.  Hopefully, you agree.


Perk Tiers:
$10: Digital Aloha & Kaha Nalu Hawaii Sticker


$25: Kaha Nalu Hawaii Sticker Pack


$25: WHAT THE SEA GIVES ME DVD


$50: Kaha Nalu Hawaii T-Shirt/Pack


$100: Kaha Nalu Hawaii Founder 



$175: KNH Speedsuit Prototype/Founder Package


$195: Custom Bula Board - SOLD OUT!


$195:  Custom Bula Board II (Second Issue- First Sold Out) 
$250: Legend's Contribution- Chris Burkard- SOLD OUT!




$250: Legend's Contribution- Mel Thoman - SOLD-OUT!

Mel Thoman-  "The Peak" -Mel's personal iconic Wedge image which his bombdrop was featured as the center spread in Surfer Magazine in the July, 1982 issue.  Could this be the best Wedge photo ever taken?

Mel  is willing to pull this one-of-a-kind 20x24" canvas print right off of his wall in support of Kaha Nalu Hawaii.

Photographer: Steve Sakamoto

$250: Legend's Contribution- Heather Brown- SOLD OUT!


$250: Legend's Contribution- The Captain Surfs- SOLD OUT!


$250: Legend's Contribution- Skye Walker - SOLD-OUT!

$250: Legend's Contribution- Matt Beard


$250: Legend's Contribution- Nick Menas - SOLD-OUT!

Nick Menas- Island Juice? Rolling Thunder? Did He Make It? Not sure what to call this one but it is beyond heavy! We are just glad Nick made this one and is alive to talk about it. Nick is generously offering up his treasured 16x20" canvas print to some lucky supporter.

Photographer: Greg Rice

Rockpiles on the North Shore

$250: KNH/ GRIPPTIDE "Watermen Series" Skatedeck



$300: Legends' Autographed Swim Fins


$500: Aloha Kaha Nalu Experience


$1000: Kaha Nalu with Mike Stewart- SOLD OUT!


$1500: Kaha Nalu with Mark Cunningham- SOLD OUT!


$2500: Ultimate Aloha Swim and Luau

If we exceed our funding goal, we have plans to increase our business offerings!
  • $20,000 - Host a Community Bodysurfing Clinic with at-risk youth
  • $25,000 - 2nd Stage Clothing: Bodysurfing Boardshorts
  • $30,000 - Secure Retail Location: Kaka'ako
  • $35,000 - 3rd Stage Clothing: Rashguards/Wetsuits/Swim fins
  • $40,000 - Development and offering of bodysurfing lessons/instruction
  • $50,000 - Retail Plan B - Repurposed Shipping Container converted into retail/office/workspace & secure location
This is definitely a passion project, and if we do NOT meet our goal we are still moving forward with a scaled back plan. Please help us achieve the ultimate.
Which brings us back to where the money goes that is raised.
For our initial $18,000 raised, funds will be used for:
Indiegogo costs and production $6,000
Website- $2,000
Art design- $1,000
Marketing- $2,000
Legal- $1,000
Research and Design- $1,000
Team- $1,000
Production- $4,000.
Again, this leaves us with a long way to go but with your support, we are going to make it.  We have faith.  If we completely sell out all of our perks, we will raise over $50,000 and that would be incredible.
Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate money to Kaha Nalu Hawaii. Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can still help support our cause by passing our message on to your friends and family. Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or your blog has a bigger impact than you know!

 Whether you contribute to our campaign or not, please take 30 seconds and share it to your social media profiles, or pass it on to someone you know that is passionate about bodysurfing!
story_txt:
CONGRATULATIONS BODYSURFERS!!!   103%!!!!WE HIT OUR GOAL OF $18,000 AND CONTRIBUTIONS ARE STILL ROLLING IN!THERE STILL ARE AMAZING PERKS AVAILABLE AND AS A BONUS WE ADDED A FOUNDER PACKAGE TO ALL PERKS OVER $100!MAHALO FROM KAHA NALU HAWAII!

http://vimeo.com/107565297

***KAHA NALU HAWAII UPDATE***
Tuesday, September 30th, 2014
With 7 days left we are nearing our goal but could use a big push to get us there.
Please let everyone you know about our Kaha Nalu Hawaii indiegogo campaign.
MAHALO FOR THE SUPPORT




MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 22, 2014

Kaha Nalu Hawaii is committed to redesigning the antiquated 'bathing-suit' as you know it.  We will introduce a line of 3 different types of suits with our first being a speedsuit which will combine olympic technology and the industry's current boardshorts.
We are offering these on a limited prototype basis.  You will be riding what our team riders wear.
*All other perks will be available November 2014.*Founder Package included*WTSGM DVD included.*International shipping add $15
TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 16, 2014Kaha Nalu Hawaii is ecstatic to announce that we have recruited one of the industry's top designers with one goal in mind...to create the ultimate bodysurfing speedtrunks line.Until now, all surf trunks have been created with the board-surfer in mind.  We love hanging out in these trunks, but try to swim and catch waves in them for a few hours and they will leave you rashed up and destroyed.
These are this year's best selling surf trunks according to SIMA (Surf Industry Manufacturers Association).  If you notice, not a lot has changed since this 1973 ad below.Yes, better materials are currently being utilized, but nothing has changed in the design which would further enhance bodysurfing performance or comfort.Kaha Nalu Hawaii is working on a breakthrough design that will change the market forever.  In fact, we will completely revolutionize the way you even look at a tradition "bathing suit."Gone will be the days of walking like a crab and fearing the hot shower.  Anybody who bodysurfs knows exactly what I am talking about.Using, top-tier technology, materials and sustainable production practices, Kaha Nalu Hawaii will be introducing our line of speed trunks in 2015.  We believe, our trunks will even become the first choice of board-surfers as well.  Welcome to the paradigm shift.Mahalo and please share this campaign with your friends.

Our Story

Aloha, my name is Sean Enoka and I am a bodysurfer from Oahu and founder of Kaha Nalu Hawaii.  Bodysurfing is the art of riding a wave without the assistance of any buoyant device such as a surfboard or bodyboard and is the traditional Hawaiian activity of Kaha Nalu.  I welcome you all to the Kaha Nalu Hawaii community and want to let you know more about what we have planned.
Our campaign goal is to finance the launch of Kaha Nalu Hawaii - a bodysurfing brand that truly represents our passion and drive towards the art of Kaha Nalu and also celebrates our roots of the Hawaiian lifestyle.  We are not only proud that Hawaii is home to some of best bodysurfing on the planet but also the tremendous amount of aloha that our community generates and shares with the world.  With these two factors being our backbone, Kaha Nalu Hawaii will focus on performance and style in our design to create equipment, apparel, and clothing that will be at the forefront of the bodysurfing experience while instilling positivity into your local community and those around you for generations to come.



This project is special to me because there is nothing really out there for bodysurfers.  For years I've wished that there were someplace that we could turn, to get products and information that are just for us, but our sport is often overlooked by the surf industry and has not quite gotten there yet.  This is where we come in and my goal is to create a brand to help spread the Hawaiian stoke, and perpetuate
Hawaiian Culture through Kaha Nalu, and bring together the Bodysurfing Ohana.  


We are building the Kaha Nalu Hawaii website geared to launch our brand to the global bodysurfing community.   We have been conducting extensive research and design and on all the products currently on the market and know that we can improve upon them.  The majority of equipment available worldwide is either geared towards surfing and snorkeling, outdated, poor quality and craftsmanship or simply designed by non-bodysurfers.  Our goal is for Kaha Nalu Hawaii to be a complete bodysurfing brand start to finish offering only the finest gear.  We are currently consulting with lead industry designers and the best wave-riders in the world to create a full line of premium bodysurfing-focused products.  Kaha Nalu Hawaii will initiate production on everything from trunks, rashguards, swim fins, to handplanes, wetsuits and clothing.  Simply put, Kaha Nalu Hawaii will create original products to raise your standards in regards to your bodysurfing equipment.

By contributing to our campaign, you are helping us progress the art and are getting in on the ground level of a grass-roots movement of a local hawaiian business that could grow into the first international bodysurfing brand ever!
   What We Need & What You Get

With our Indiegogo campaign we are attempting to create a spark in the global bodysurfing community that will hopefully lead to a huge fire.  We normally have problems with hand-outs unless they are for a really good cause.  And yes, this happens to be a great cause and you get some really cool rewards in return in addition to our deepest gratitude.  Our initial goal of raising $18,000 is to merely cover all start-up costs and begin limited run productions until we get a stronger foothold.  Our dream goal is to raise closer to $48,000 but we are willing to work slowly and diligently for as long as it takes.  We really want to start off on the right foot and if we do exceed our goal, then we have some exciting plans to take it to the next level but first let's talk about our reward system so many graciously donated to and what you get for your hard-earned money you supported Kaha Nalu Hawaii with. 


Out of respect, we reached out to many bodysurfing legends and explained our reasoning and goals for Kaha Nalu Hawaii and to see if we were in the right track.  Remarkably, every single one came back in utter support.  In fact, they all offered up amazing donations for the bodysurfing community.  So whether you are the greatest bodysurfer of all-time or a nervous grom about to go for their first swim , we thank you in all advance.  We cannot make this possible without everybody's support and we will recognize and reward all of our backers, regardless of donation amount.  Please remember, we tried to figure out a breakdown that will stoke out all supporter yet still raise as much funds as we can.  Hopefully, you agree.

Perk Tiers:

$10: Digital Aloha & Kaha Nalu Hawaii Sticker



$25: Kaha Nalu Hawaii Sticker Pack






$25: WHAT THE SEA GIVES ME DVD$50: Kaha Nalu Hawaii T-Shirt/Pack






$100: Kaha Nalu Hawaii Founder 









$175: KNH Speedsuit Prototype/Founder Package$195: Custom Bula Board - SOLD OUT!





$195:  Custom Bula Board II (Second Issue- First Sold Out) 


$250: Legend's Contribution- Chris Burkard- SOLD OUT!





$250: Legend's Contribution- Mel Thoman - SOLD-OUT!




Mel Thoman-  "The Peak" -Mel's personal iconic Wedge image which his bombdrop was featured as the center spread in Surfer Magazine in the July, 1982 issue.  Could this be the best Wedge photo ever taken?
Mel  is willing to pull this one-of-a-kind 20x24" canvas print right off of his wall in support of Kaha Nalu Hawaii.
Photographer: Steve Sakamoto


$250: Legend's Contribution- Heather Brown- SOLD OUT!





$250: Legend's Contribution- The Captain Surfs- SOLD OUT!





$250: Legend's Contribution- Skye Walker - SOLD-OUT!


$250: Legend's Contribution- Matt Beard






$250: Legend's Contribution- Nick Menas - SOLD-OUT!





Nick Menas- Island Juice? Rolling Thunder? Did He Make It? Not sure what to call this one but it is beyond heavy! We are just glad Nick made this one and is alive to talk about it. Nick is generously offering up his treasured 16x20" canvas print to some lucky supporter.
Photographer: Greg Rice
Rockpiles on the North Shore$250: KNH/ GRIPPTIDE "Watermen Series" Skatedeck




$300: Legends' Autographed Swim Fins






$500: Aloha Kaha Nalu Experience





$1000: Kaha Nalu with Mike Stewart- SOLD OUT!






$1500: Kaha Nalu with Mark Cunningham- SOLD OUT!



$2500: Ultimate Aloha Swim and Luau




If we exceed our funding goal, we have plans to increase our business offerings!


$20,000 - Host a Community Bodysurfing Clinic with at-risk youth
$25,000 - 2nd Stage Clothing: Bodysurfing Boardshorts
$30,000 - Secure Retail Location: Kaka'ako
$35,000 - 3rd Stage Clothing: Rashguards/Wetsuits/Swim fins
$40,000 - Development and offering of bodysurfing lessons/instruction
$50,000 - Retail Plan B - Repurposed Shipping Container converted into retail/office/workspace & secure location

This is definitely a passion project, and if we do NOT meet our goal we are still moving forward with a scaled back plan. Please help us achieve the ultimate.
Which brings us back to where the money goes that is raised.
For our initial $18,000 raised, funds will be used for:
Indiegogo costs and production $6,000
Website- $2,000
Art design- $1,000
Marketing- $2,000
Legal- $1,000
Research and Design- $1,000
Team- $1,000
Production- $4,000.
Again, this leaves us with a long way to go but with your support, we are going to make it.  We have faith.  If we completely sell out all of our perks, we will raise over $50,000 and that would be incredible.
Other Ways You Can Help



We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate money to Kaha Nalu Hawaii. Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can still help support our cause by passing our message on to your friends and family. Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or your blog has a bigger impact than you know!
 Whether you contribute to our campaign or not, please take 30 seconds and share it to your social media profiles, or pass it on to someone you know that is passionate about bodysurfing!

story:
Yatra is Hindi for 'Pilgrimage'

My name is james dean conklin. I am a co-founder of the solar-powered musical environmental activism project called Solar Punch.  We perform to inform - about the environment, about sustainable living, about organic agriculture, about solutions to climate challenges and many other concepts regarding mindfulness and the planet. 

Our group has had important, eye-opening tours of India since our participation in the ground-breaking 2009 Climate Solutions Road Tour. 

On one such tour in November 2011, we visited the Indian state of Jammu & Kashmir. Our hosts, Reetu Asrani & Owais Raheem of IYCN J&K, shared with us much of their incredible environmental activism efforts in this remote region of the Indian subcontinent.

One particular effort they have embarked upon, and now in their fourth year, is the 'greening up' of the Amarnath Yatra.

The Amarnath Yatra is one of the holiest of Hindu pilgrimages and in the six week period of time that it is open to Yatris (pilgrims), usually during the summer months of July and August, several hundred thousand devout Hindus make their way to the Amarnath cave.

The impact that this many people has upon the fragile Himalayan landscape is striking and noticeable. Along with the Yatris come food vendors, novelty vendors, lots of garbage and - of course - enormous amounts of single-use plastic water bottles.

There is no facility to capture and cart the waste off-sight so it usually collects in large piles along the trail itself as well as at the base camps and the surrounding area.

During 2013's Yatra, Reetu and Owais installed several water purification units and encouraged shop keepers and pilgrims alike to fill reusable water bottles from the units, reducing the plastic bottle waste and providing clean, safe water from a secure source.

We need to install water purification units.

This year, the team wants to install more than 30 units, covering most of the base camps the Yatris muster at before making the walk / climb to the cave with the aspect of Shiva visible in the form of giant blue ice formation.

We in Solar Punch are trying to raise funds for two of these units.  Reetu and Owais from IYCN J&K have no particular fund or capital to work with and have only gotten this far by the kindness of investors and people like us, making small offerings when we can.

Each unit costs roughly $2,000 USD. Our campaign is seeking a few hundred dollars past that to compensate for the various processing fees and the perks we'd like to offer our supporters.

Funding Breakdown

  • $4000 gets two water purification units ($2000 per unit) 
  • $500 will offset the processing fees and cost of the perks we are offering for generous funders.
  • One fun perk is a 3/4 scale custom painted guitar, signed by the Solar Punch team!
  • If we don't hit our goal, any funds we do collect will still go directly to the IYCN J&K team with a mandate that the funds be applied to the cost of water units..

The impacts from this effort...

  • Help reduce waste and contribute to the overall health of the ecology of this incredible natural resource.
  • Reinforce the essential connection to the natural world that is embedded within the Hindu philosophies.
  • Empower 'ordinary' citizens with responsible choices and embrace the larger, needed discussion about how every one of our 'footfalls' impacts the world around us.
  • Build a consensus on best practices for the ongoing Amarnath Yatra experience, ensuring a positive journey for future Yatris.
  • Reduce the overall use of single-use plastic water bottles and encourage deeper consideration for water itself. The water purification unit initiative is one of several strategies that Reetu and Owais have taken up.

If you can't support us through your money, please consider supporting us by sharing this campaign with those who might.

  • Post this campaign to your social media networks - Facebook, Twitter, etc.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

The water purification unit initiative is one of several strategies that Reetu and Owais have taken up to help protect this fragile slice of the Himalayas.  

To learn more of what Reetu' and Owais has accomplished so far, please visit their IYCN J&K page here = http://iycn.in/jk-chapter-profile/

(IYCN = Indian Youth Climate Network)

And for a look at what our group Solar Punch does, please visit our site here = www.solarpunch.org

story:
The Keepers of the Water (KOW) is a nationally incorporated non-profit organization comprised of First Nations, Metis, Inuit, environmental groups, and concerned watershed citizens working together for the protection of water, land and air and all living things today and tomorrow. KOW was formerly established in 2006, during its inaugural gathering held in LIIDLII KUE, Denendeh, Fort Simpson, NWT.

The KOW recognize that clean water is a fundamental human right and is essential to and for environmental, communal and human health. KOW are guided by both Indigenous Elders Traditional knowledge and western science. We recognize and honor the legal importance of First Nation’s, Aboriginal and Treaty Right to the water, land and livelihood rights. We recognize that significant negative accumulative impacts are compromising the health and integrity of the rivers and watersheds, fish, and wildlife populations and adversely affecting the exercise of Aboriginal and Treat Right to hunt, trap, and fish within Indigenous Peoples’ traditional territories.

KOW Vision: Citizens working together for the protection of water, land and air and thus for all living things today and tomorrow.

KOW Mission: To unite the peoples of the Churchill Watershed to ensure and protect water and watershed lands for ecological, social, cultural and community health and well – being, with guest speakers, power point presentations, elders oral history, panels, question and answer periods.

Keepers of the Water Beaver River Council

The KOW Beaver River Council (BRC) is a satellite arm of the national organization and active members of the National Keepers of the Water and Keepers of the Athabasca.

The KOW BRC of Cold Lake, Alberta (Beaver Clan) was approached by the KOW national organization to host this prestigious KOW Conference and Gathering. Previous Gatherings have been held in Fort Nelson, B.C., Fort Chipewyan, Alberta, Wollastan Lake, Sask., La Brochet, MB., and Fort MacMurray, AB.

The BRC Committee is committed to hosting the Conference and Gathering in partnership with the Cold Lake First Nations Chief and Council. As hosts of this KOW Gathering, we recognize the need to build a framework to complement and enhance the gathering experience with our partners, the community and all interested parties.

This campaign is to assist with all associated costs to holding the event such as food, lodging, protocol and amenities.

story:
We reached our first milestone in just 3 days!! Thank you so much to everyone who has contributed! 

Our new stretch goal of $800, which we are already well on our way to, will allow us to add a data logging sensor array to the GoPro!

The plans for this open source sensor suite can be found on the MIT website: http://seaperch.mit.edu/sensors.php

This sensor array includes: conductivity, temperature, depth and light

We will be building one to go with the GoPro for more environmental data collection that can be collected by citizen scientists on their dives without changing anything about the way they dive!

The purpose of this device is to collect even more critical data on pollution and climate change metrics, gain deeper knowledge of how coral reefs function and fluctuate in their environment, and attempt to find any relationships with or proxies for environmental variables that can be identified from video alone, which would dramatically reduce data collection costs. That means...MORE DATA! It is very likely that this will be possible for at least the parameter of 'light', but maybe others too if we're lucky! 

Thank you for supporting this growing project!

Coral reefs need our help!

All of our help! Coral reefs are stressed from things like pollution, climate change, overfishing and disease, but some coral reefs cope with these things better than others. So, why is that? What is it about the coral reefs that can handle human impacts that is different from those that can't?

Answering that question requires a LOT of data. More data than any scientific team can collect on their own. Luckily, coral reefs are adored and visited by divers all over the world, whose combined underwater time is astronomically large compared to coral reef ecologists.

My dream is to equip every interested diver with a simple, readily available tool for data gathering - a GoPro!

From just a video of a reef, we can learn so many things like who is there, what they're up to, how neighbors are interacting with each other and why they're there. These data allow us build a comprehensive model of how all of the interacting parts come together to be a functioning and beautiful coral reef ecosystem!


What We Need

In order to figure out how exactly to use a GoPro in a scientifically meaningful way, I plan to take one on an upcoming expedition to the South Pacific where I will be collecting data the old-fashioned way AND with the GoPro. I can compare the two data types, and develop methods for citizen scientists to collect video data that captures all of the important experimental principles so that we can use it alongside the traditional data!

To start this ambitious project, I need one GoPro and one color-correcting filter. That's it! All of my other scientific expenses are already covered.

I will use the information to publish a manual for GoPro data collection, and the next phase of the project will be creating a database for citizen scientists to easily upload their data.

The Impact

Citizen scientist divers are already mobilized and accidentally collecting much-needed coral reef data by simply taking photos and video. With a few parameters, the activity they're already doing could help deepen and broaden our understanding of how coral reefs work, which is the only way we will be able to save them!

A lot of people think coral reefs are doomed, but they don't know that there are many examples in geologic and recent history of coral reefs bouncing back after being seriously degraded. Finding out why that happens is the realistically optimistic key to saving our magical coral reefs!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can email me to become a testing diver, or if you have database building skills, we could really use your help! If you love coral reefs, we will get you involved!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt: Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:  Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

A scout is supposed to be a benefit to the community that they live in, helping those in need.  Many of the homeless in our communities need more than just a roof and a bed.  They need confidence, knowledge, understanding and a new way of thinking.  Many have never raised their own food or cared for a beautiful flower.   As a Life Scout, I am raising money to provide an opportunity at a YMCA shelter for guests to do just that.

What We Need

  • Funds will be used to purchase planter bed kids to assemble on-site as well as feed volunteers. The planters will be filled with vegetable starts and native flowers and plants.  A guide for care and uses for the vegetable as well as information on the ornamental plants will be created for the shelter guests.
  • We have the labor to build the planters, but not the funds.  You can help us make the Shelter a better and more empowering and therapeutic place to be.

The Impact

  • Most of the guests at this shelter in Columbus, OH are single women and families.  Many have never planted or cared for vegetables or flowers.  Fresh veggies and pretty flowers are probably not at the top of their lists.  They were just trying to pay rent and utilities.  Through the YMCA, we have an opportunity to provide a means of knowledge, emotional support, distraction from their circumstances, and an opportunity to care for something other than themselves. 
  • It will give them much needed pride in accomplishment.  That self-confidence will then translate into other portions of their lives, showing them that they can do it.  It will provide the emotional support needed to improve their lives and help them become more self-sufficient.
  • The Homeless are often hidden from view with the exception of the occasional panhandler at a freeway exit.  This project will increase knowledge and awareness of the homeless in our communities. 

    Challenges

    The biggest challenge with this project is obtaining financial support.  We have the volunteers and the desire to make a difference.  Projects that help the homeless can be difficult to fund raise.  The project will go forward.  We will build as many planters as we can purchase or obtain donations.  With your financial help, we can positively impact the lives of homeless people in Columbus, OH.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Get involved in your local community.  Volunteer at a shelter year-round.  There are resources, like the YMCA, Salvation Army or other homeless service providers out there you can plug into.  They need help and volunteers year-round.  You could be that person that inspires someone to take that first step to providing for them selves and others.

story:
Our Mission: 

We are biking 1,500 miles around the state of California to promote responsible water usage and to remind communities from where their water comes.

Our Strategy:

  • We will be partnering with K-12 schools along the way to deliver lessons on water history, sustainability, and appreciation.
  • We will be documenting the stories of farms, small businesses, and water districts committed to finding ways to limit their water usage.
  • We will be interacting with thousands of Californians and encouraging them to critically examine their relationship with fresh water.

Why Water:

Preserving water is a global issue. California is in its 4th year of a historic drought, and its freshwater resources are dwindling at an alarming rate. We feel the need to build community around water sustainability and foster a water conscious California.

 What We Need To Succeed:

(California Water Cycle is a 501c3 Tax Deductible Non-Profit Organization)

We need funding for: 

  • Educational Supplies - digital media, lecture & laboratory materials, printing services, etc
  • Community Events - Wild & Scenic Film Festival in St. Helena, community bike rides, etc.
  • Research - 2016 Eco-Farm Conference, farm tours, water facility tours, etc 
  • Travel Costs

Your Impact:

You will help to provide: 

  • Free education for California public schools
  • General awareness of water-related issues 
  • Inspiration for environmental activism
  • A more water-conscious California 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on Facebook & Instagram @californiawatercycle
  • Share stories about water use in your community
  • Connect us with friends and family along the way

Thank you! 

Mike & Sam - California Water Cycle

story:
Who Am I?

Hello, my name is Yusuph Masanja, a conscious activist dedicated to Climate and Social Justice. I am a graduate from the Young African Leaders Initiative in East Africa (President’s Obama’s Initiative) and the first cohort of GATHER (a capacity-building curriculum for grassroots organizers). I am currently working to create global communities committed to the mutual exchange and implementation of ideas, that support Climate Justice, Peacebuilding and Social Justice as a founding partner of Global Compassion.

 

What Are My Goals?

With this crowdfunding campaign, I am trying to achieve the goal of participating in the "ClimateForce: 2019" Arctic Expedition in June this year. This carbon neutral expedition provides an opportunity for youth leaders from more than 100 countries in the world to learn first-hand about the diverse effects of our climate change crisis and effective measures for mitigation and adaptation. 

The loss of ice will inevitably have devastating consequences for all those who depend on it.

I am grateful to be selected as the only African to join the Arctic Expedition  and to be supported by the government as a Tanzanian "Ambassador" for this global cause under the leadership of Polar explorer and environmental leader Robert Swan, one of the world’s leading climate change activists, and the first person to walk to both North and South Poles. 

The Expedition will take place in both Oslo, Norway and Svalbard, Norway from June 15 to June 26, 2019.

 

For ten years now, I have been working in conservation and humanitarian activities, and I would like to use this expedition as an opportunity to get expert-level environmental sustainability education in order to be able to create a Sustainability Learning Center in Tanzania. A center where people from around the globe can visit to learn sustainable practices. A center where individuals, organizations and governments can learn together and adopt sustainability practices suitable to individuals’ lifestyle, national climate policies, and global eco-friendly cooperation.

Lack of physical representations of sustainability concepts and theories stalls our readiness to change. We need to see how potential solutions can be implemented in our daily lives most effectively. 

The center will provide a collaborative environment designed to create innovative solutions that will help mitigate the impact of climate change.  Currently, 80% of all Tanzanians depend on agriculture, forestry and fishery resources for their living and 70% of all natural disasters in Tanzania are climate change related. The adverse impacts of climate change are already having their toll in the livelihoods of people in the country.  The recent severe droughts which hit most parts of the country lead to severe food shortages, food insecurity, water scarcity, hunger and acute shortage of power. Tanzania and its’ people are highly vulnerable to the impacts of climate change.

Photo credit: Imani Nsamila.

The Impact of Your Donation?

Your donation to help me join this expedition and its “Leadership-on-The-Edge” course in the Arctic, will benefit me with the knowledge and skills necessary to make my vision of a Sustainability Learning Center happen. Thus, you can make a difference now by supporting this campaign and potentially engage in the plans to make it happen. The center will integrate innovation, children participatory research programs and youth employability solutions. Also, it will act as a community space for nurturing and deepening individuals’ connection.

I have already started to engage my government through the Vice President’s Office for Union Matters and Environment, Local Civil Society Organizations, and now I am reaching out to you.

While developing the learning center is a long-term undertaking, the immediate goal I will be working on after returning back from the Arctic this June, will involve: a) sharing the knowledge and skills I will gain from the Arctic with my fellow Tanzanians, b) conducting dialogues with policymakers, c) and creating an outdoor experiential learning curriculum for Climate Change Education to be used in the Sustainability Learning Center and adopted in schools.

I need your help to raise USD $21,500 for the expedition cost, travel fare, equipment, and insurance. Any contribution amount is appreciated to help me reach this goal. Below is a breakdown:

  • $ 17,000 – Expedition cost.
  • $ 2,000 – Travel fare.
  • $ 2,000 – Equipment / Extreme weather clothes.
  • $ 500 – Insurance.

With your support, I hope to raise $ 21,500 through this campaign by June 5th. 

If I do NOT succeed to reach the fundraising goal, I will use whatever funds are raised to kick start initial steps for creating the Sustainability Learning Center by mobilizing volunteers and green businesses to work together.

 

Other ways you can help.

You can also help by getting the word out, share this campaign with friends and families using Indiegogo share tools on this platform.

Please see one of my successful track records with projects like this: Common Humanity: A New Workshop on Ethics.

 

Unique Perks.

  • $25: A Thank you note.
  • $50: Photos from the Arctic with Robert Swan.
  • $100: Photos of the Arctic Environment. 
  • $250: A video of the Arctic Environment.
  • $500: A personal thank you note signed by Minister of the Environment in my country.
  • $ 750: A book signed by Dr. Jane. "Seeds of Hope: Wisdom and Wonder from the World of Plants". 
  • $ 1,000: Your name will be engraved in the sustainability Learning Center to be appreciated by everyone who visits.

Note: All donors will be updated on a monthly basis about the development of the learning center.

story:
The Green Neighbors:
The Green Neighbors Education Committee, Inc. is a small group of former ACORN members who have joined together as volunteers working to bring GREEN to our communities in Boston, Massachusetts. In July of 2010 we began providing GREEN information via our Low Carbon workshops; Energy Fairs; Spring Plantings and more. We were approved for our Tax-Exempt (501c3) status in November of 2012.

Director Owen Toney:
My personal interests in community organizing, climate change, anthropology and improving conditions in Africa along with having family friends from and in Liberia led us to start the Sustainable Development for Liberia project.

What's happening:
Less than 20% of people in Liberia have access to electricity. Unemployment is over 90%. Many Liberians with access to electricity run generators burning polluting unsustainable fossil fuels to produce their electricity. With Liberia rebuilding, there is an opportunity for us (you and I) to help them use GREEN technology and techniques to rebuild in a sustainable way.

Phase I

Teaching Solar - Creating Careers:
We have engaged Dr. Richard Komp a world renowned solar pioneer, inventor and teacher to hold a workshop on solar panels in Monrovia, Liberia. Twenty-five (25) workers will be taught to Design, Assemble, Install, Maintain and Repair (DAIMR) solar Photovoltaic panels and other devices. This training will lead to permanent careers providing the income to support the graduates and their families. Additionally, these new Solar Technicians will be able to bring electricity to their friends and neighbors throughout Liberia. The solar technicians will work in the capital city Monrovia for six months. They will then go back to their home counties and teach local people to become Solar Technicians. This will provide jobs and keep the knowledge sustainable.
Often, well intentioned International Development projects break down and end up as giant paper weights because the local people aren’t taught to care for them. Using DAIMR for development projects keeps them sustainable as local people can keep them going.

The money is for:
We need your financial support to send Dr. Komp to Liberia and to pay for materials the Solar Tech’s will use to get started deploying solar panels. Some fragile materials can be brought via airlines. Bulkier items must be placed in a container and shipped via ocean freight. And all of that needs to be paid for.

Whether or not we meet our goal in this crowdfunding campaign, all funds raised will still go towards accomplishing our mission of creating sustainable jobs for Liberians

Why it will work:
While the Green Neighbors have held a number of successful GREEN events in Boston, this will be our first international effort. We chose Dr. Komp (www.mainesolar.org) for his many years of experience teaching solar around the world. His experience will ensure that the solar Technicians are skilled and ready to improve their country.

Your financial support:
Success breeds success! Your support will mean the difference in making this Phase I of our project a success and our ability to have additional programs such as biodigestors; micro-hydroelectric; Aquaponics and more. Your donations are tax-deductible.
Would your group, church; fraternal; social, etc., organization be willing to sponsor a worker for the workshop? A donation of $1,000.00 will provide for the Solar Technicians full kit of equipment and cover expenses the training period and a little beyond.

How else you can help:
In addition to financial support, we need you to help us get the word out about our Sustainable Development for Liberia project. Please use Indiegogo’s tools for outreach. But especially, your help calling your friends and family and asking them to consider supporting the project will be invaluable! That personal touch makes a huge difference.

The Future is GREENer:
Last but not least, we plan to introduce many other GREEN technologies and techniques to Liberia. If you have GREEN skills and/or knowledge that you think may be helpful in bringing sustainable tech in a DAIMR way to our friends in Liberia, please contact us.

What can YOU do to make Sustainable Development for Liberia a reality?

In the non-profit world, raising funds is often called DEVELOPMENT.

Sign on with the Green Neighbors as a Sustainable Developer.

As a Sustainable Developer we ask that you:

1.  Call people that you already know

2.  Tell them why you are supporting our Sustainable Development for Liberia campaign

3.  Direct them to the website

4.  Ask them to also support the campaign by making a donation

5.  Make a follow up call to see how it went for them

And that’s it! Not too tough when you consider what good your efforts will do.

Are you ready to make a difference fighting climate change and bringing careers to workers who desperately need it?

Email your Name and telephone number to sustainableliberia@hotmail.com to get started. We’ll follow up with tips on making the calls.

Thank you for helping!

  The Green Neighbors Education Committee, Inc.


Contact us at sustainableliberia@hotmail.com or (617) 427-6293.

The Green Neighbors Education Committee, Inc. thanks you for considering supporting our Sustainable Development for Liberia project. 

              Find more Green Neighbors activities at http://otoney.wix.com/gnec

story:
Let's face facts: Canada's not doing so well on the environmental front. We've muzzled our scientists and relaxed policies, and we might be headed towards developing even more infrastructure for fossil fuels. Considering we've got vast wilderness and natural resources, we need a more sustainable plan.

Although environmental news can seem depressing, we're here to show Canadians that it's time to make a difference. The Starfish Canada is dedicated to bringing a different angle to Canadian environmental news. We also want to show you those who are making the changes needed for a greener and more sustainable future.

This holiday season, you can help us make our work 

Here's what we'll do with your donation.

We're looking for $500 to help take The Starfish Canada to the next degree. We've got volunteer chapters set up in Ontario and British Columbia & we'd like to incorporate as a nonprofit organization (about $300).

We'd also like to ensure that next year's Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25 is the best one yet. We aim to do so by covering our printing costs ($100) and delivering a prize to the Top Environmentalist Under 25 ($100). Your funds will directly assist those doing great work in environmentalism in Canada.

We'll make your donation go even further.

For $25, you can get a feature story on our website. $100 donations will provide an organization of your choice to receive advertising space on our site. $250 donations will go directly to the Top 25 Environmentalist Under 25 for 2014.

That's not all. For every dollar donation, an anonymous donor will match donations dollar for dollar (up to $500)!

Thank You.

Your donation will allow us to continue recognizing and rewarding great work in the environmental sector. As fellow Canadians, we thank you for helping make our nation one full of natural resources for years to come.

Please do share our campaign through Indiegogo's share tools and via social media. Every share/tweet counts!

We've got volunteer chapters set up in Ontario and British Columbia & we'd like to incorporate as a nonprofit organization (about $300).We'd also like to ensure that next year's Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25 is the best one yet. We aim to do so by covering our printing costs ($100) and delivering a prize to the Top Environmentalist Under 25 ($100). Your funds will directly assist those doing great work in environmentalism in Canada.We'll make your donation go even further.For $25, you can get a feature story on our website. $100 donations will provide an organization of your choice to receive advertising space on our site. $250 donations will go directly to the Top 25 Environmentalist Under 25 for 2014.That's not all. For every dollar donation, an anonymous donor will match donations dollar for dollar (up to $500)!Thank You.Your donation will allow us to continue recognizing and rewarding great work in the environmental sector. As fellow Canadians, we thank you for helping make our nation one full of natural resources for years to come.Please do share our campaign through Indiegogo's share tools and via social media. Every share/tweet counts!

story:
How wonderful would it be to build and live in a beautiful ecovillage immersed in nature? That´s my biggest dream.

 

Therefore I am going on a tour in Europe, starting in France, and live on organic farms as a volunteer, in order to learn the many activities of farm life: organic agriculture, gardening, eco-construction and much more. This will allow me to gather precious knowledge for my future project: the creation of an ecovillage.

I need contributions to fund my training period as a volunteer first and to build an ecovillage later on.

Your contribution is very precious! Our world needs more projects like this, more people working together for a sustainable world.

 

I hope to meet you in my ecovillage one day and share with you the fruits of my project  :)

 

 

Monica

Monica

story:
English:

The ancient city of Paestum, founded by the Greeks in southern Italy at the end of the seventh century BC and since 1998 in the UNESCO list of World Heritage Properties, is currently suffering a serious crisis due to land ownership in private hands, which is limiting its preservation and development and causing serious problems to the structures not yet excavated, but damaged by mechanical equipment used for agriculture.

Legambiente Onlus, the largest Italian environmental organization, launched an environmental shareholder to buy those lands, protecting them from unsuitable using and returning them to tourists’ enjoyment.

To purchase the first site takes about 70,000 dollars.

The common thread of Paestumanità is the participation of people, organizations, associations, which together can participate to the management of our cultural heritage and want to take care of it along with relevant institutions, to be a little less users of a cultural service and a bit more citizens for the common good, becoming shareholders!

Commitment to the project consists in buying one or more Good Share, the cost is 65 dollars each.

You can join individually and become a shareholder of Paestumanità.

The funds will help the purchase of Paestumanità individual lots and the payment of legal fees, in compliance with applicable laws. For the management of real estate assets Legambiente will provide a foundation to ensure the utmost transparency.

You can help spreading out the initiative:

• By talking about it to family and friends.

• By posting our banner on your personal sites.

• By sending a Paestumanità postcard to friends abroad.

• By organizing initiatives to support it (meetings, presentations and events).

• By promoting Paestumanità within your public initiatives through the material you can find here.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Italiano:

L'antica città di Paestum, fondata dai greci nell'Italia meridionale alla fine del VII secolo a.C. e dal 1996 nella lista Unesco dei Beni Patrimonio dell'Umanità, soffre oggi una grave crisi dovuta alla proprietà dei terreni, in mano a privati, che ne limitano la salvaguardia e la valorizzazione e causano gravi problemi alle strutture ancora non scavate, ma danneggiate dai mezzi meccanici usati in agricoltura.

Legambiente Onlus, la più grande associazione ambientalista italiana, ha lanciato un azionariato ambientale per acquistare quei terreni, metterli a riparo da utilizzi non idonei e restituirli alla fruizione dei turisti.

Per procedere all'acquisto del primo lotto occorrono circa 70.000 dollari.

Puoi aderire individualmente: e diventi azionista di Paestumanità

I fondi raccolti da Paestumanità contribuiranno all'acquisto di singole partite e al pagamento delle spese legali, in conformità con le leggi vigenti. Per la gestione del patrimonio immobiliare Legambiente fornirà una base per garantire la massima trasparenza.

È possibile contribuire a diffondere l'iniziativa:

• Parlandone a parenti e amici.

• Pubblicando il nostro banner sui vostri siti personali.

• Con l'invio di una cartolina Paestumanità agli amici all'estero.

• Attraverso l'organizzazione di iniziative per sostenere il progetto (incontri, presentazioni ed eventi).

• Promuovendo Paestumanità all'interno delle vostre iniziative pubbliche attraverso il materiale che potete trovare qui.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#SAVEPAESTUM

www.paestumanita.it  • www.legambiente.it

Facebook • Twitter • Google+ 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Talk about the project: - Parlano del progetto:


SAVE PAESTUM

Riccardo Dalisi Art for Paestumanità project

The Neapolitan artist Riccardo Dalisi, international architect and designer, has decided to donate his work called “Sustainable Jewels” collection to Legambiente to support  Paestumanità fundraising.

Women in candy wrappers (14 pieces available)


Riccardo Dalisi painting, realized on recycled cardboard (8 pieces available)

story:
WHAT IS ECO-BLAST?

Can you imagine more than 100 children singing ‘I Am The Future?’ Or dancing to ‘Up Your Watershed?’ Or creating eco-art masterpieces? Or picking organic fruit and veggies to prepare for each other? That’s the power of ECO-BLAST Kids’ Camp & Concert! 

ECO-BLAST is designed and delivered by eco-education experts to connect children with nature and each other through song, dance, art, and interactive play. More than 100 kids ages 5-12 will learn and perform ecological songs written and taught by the Artist Response Team. They’ll express their thoughts and feelings about the environment through dance, and they’ll create eco-art that reflects their unique interpretation of our natural world. Campers will also learn how to be part of the solution rather than part of the problem by saving water and energy and reducing waste. And they’ll visit local urban gardens and make soups and salads for each other with the produce they pick.

The week culminates in a concert where campers will showcase their songs, dances, and art projects. Local eco-related non-profit organizations will be invited to share information about their services as part of the event.

 

WHY DO WE NEED ECO-BLAST?

Research shows that children who interact regularly with nature are happier, healthier, and more likely to help protect our precious planet than those who don’t. Why then, are children disappearing from the outdoors at a rate that would put them at the top of any endangered species list? Experts suggest that urbanization is the primary culprit. Studies prove that kids who are disconnected from nature are often isolated, sedentary, and reliant on technology for information and entertainment. This ‘nature deficit disorder’ can cause loneliness, obesity, addictions to electronic devices, and a lack of appreciation for the wonder of nature.

But when nature is celebrated through eco-education and enhanced through the sensory stimulation provided by music, movement, and creative expression, children learn to connect with themselves, nature, and each other. In the short term, the outcomes are magical and memorable; in the long term, the impacts are meaningful and momentous!

 

WHY SHOULD YOU BE AN ECO-BLAST BOOSTER?

One person really can make a difference, especially a youngster who’s passionate about change! Typically, when children know better, they do better. Therefore, their ECO-BLAST experiences will be reflected in behaviour change that impacts them as individuals, their families, their neighbourhoods, and their communities. Whether you give a little or a lot, your contribution will surely increase community well-being now and well into the future. And if you send a kid to camp through a scholarship of $129, you’ll be exposing him/her to an experience the family mighty not otherwise be able to afford.

 

WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

The ECO-BLAST budget is $30,000, which covers event expenses such as instruction, food, transportation, art materials, and promotion. We intend to raise one-third of the needed revenue through camp registrations, one-third through grants and sponsorships, and the final third through this crowdfunding campaign. Some of the crowdfunding revenue will be used for scholarships to cover camp registration for children who might not otherwise be able to attend. We’re aiming for 10 scholarships at $129 each. If we raise more than $10,000 through this campaign, we will offer more scholarships and guarantee that all food is organic and locally produced.

 

WHAT WILL YOU GET FOR YOUR SUPPORT?

Join the ECO-BLAST Boosters Club and help cultivate this amazing event! All rewards will connect you directly to the kids’ eco-activities…meaning you’ll learn as they learn! Imagine, you could get a DVD of the entire ECO-BLAST concert, or an eco-art masterpiece created especially for you. And if you liked camp ambassador Eli Ord’s ECO-BLAST jingle, you could have your name included in a video of the full-length ECO-BLAST song!

story:
GNJaguar is an interactive guide of the 6 wild cats that inhabit Costa Rica. It's time to grow the list and make it global. Help us raise awareness!

 

What is GreenNoise?

GreenNoise is an interactive platform created to spread the voice of nature around the world. In an attempt to create awareness on the conservation of our Planet and it's Rainforest, we came up with GreenNoise: 100% real sounds from the most pristine forest of Costa Rica. As you submerge yourself in the magic of GreenNoise, rediscover the benefits and the profound effects that the voice of nature has upon us.  Our mission is to inform users about the fragility and vitality of the rainforest. Be part of the change! It’s live and happening! 

 

What is GNJaguar?

GreenNoise has added a new module: GNJaguar. This is the first interactive platform that allows people to learn, watch and listen to the 6 species of wild felines that inhabit Costa Rica. A guide that can change the sad road in which these endangered species are headed.  With our slogan "to save them, we must know them", our goal is to educate people. To save these endangered species, we must learn about them. As part of our virtual community, Centro de Rescate Las Pumas and Panthera (organizations dedicated to the preservation of wild cats) have worked together with us collaborating with a weekly blog. With the intention to exchange vital information among themselves and anyone interested in their work. Of the 37 wild felines in the world, 12 of them inhabit the American continent, and six of them live in Costa Rica, all of whichare currently endangered species.

As we successfully launched GNJaguar, the Costa Rican government declared the National Day of Wild Felines on July 4th.

www.greennoise.cr/gnjaguar

Media link:

http://www.nacion.com/vivir/ciencia/Iniciativa-...

 

What you’ll help us achieve

After acknowledging the importance and success of this interactive guide, we have decided that we're gonna make it global! With your help, GNJaguar seeks to expand to create the first wild feline guide to educate the public of the current state of feline populations around the world. 

 

GreenNoise is committed to wild feline conservation in Costa Rica. With your contribution, we will be able to expand our efforts globally and reach out to the public in order to inform them on the current condition of wild feline populations all around the world and the conservation efforts made by non-profit and for profit entities.  

What We Need & What You Get

With your valuable contribution, we aim to collect $35,000, which will fund the development of an educational guide of the 37 wild feline species. This interactive platform will be complete with audio, videos, and high quality photographs, and will include special information on each specie.   

What You’ll Get

This educational guide will be offered in over 10 different languages, and available as an App for Android, iPhone and iPad. We will all have valuable information in the palm of your hand and that alone can make a difference on the conservation of these endangered animals!

If we are unable to reach our goal, we will put your valued contributions towards creating the guide and including as many wild feline species as possible. 

The Impact

Our goal is to make a positive impact on wild feline conservation through education.  Our educational guide will encourage the public to learn about these creatures in a fun and accessible way. making human coexistence with nature, a positive impact.  

GNJaguar is the first platform in Costa Rica, to function as a link between organizations involved in wild feline conservation. We will continue to look for and establish relationships between organizations around the world that are concerned with feline conservation.  

Our first platform, GreenNoise, has become a successful conservation effort, where we have brought the sounds of nature to the world, and have partnered with Costa Rican flora & fauna organizations, as well as governmental entities, to share the beauty of undisturbed and protected sites.  

We have shared the essentiality of the Costa Rican rainforest to people concerned with their daily hectic lives. 

Our web platform, GNJaguar now functions as an educational website for people interested in our efforts and people desiring to learn about the wild felines of Costa Rica. The GNJaguar Blog is the only site of its kind, where researchers, students and organizations involved in preserving wild feline species, exchange ideas and developments.

 

Other ways you can help!

Visit our website and learn more about the wild felines of Costa Rica and South America.  

Share this campaign with your friends and make your contribution roar!

story:
Dear Family & Friends,

I am currently inspired and excited by my acceptance and upcoming participation in this 5-Month Natural Building Apprenticeship by Kleiwerks International, a woman-run organization that focuses on teaching WOMEN to become leaders in the natural building movement. I'd love to invite you to support me on my journey ahead, and I thank you in advance for anything you are able to offer.  This means so much to me and I look forward to using what I learn in ways that help to heal our planet...

As many of you know, I have spent the last four years in the Peruvian Amazon, working with indigenous people around environmental and social justice issues. While it has not always been easy I have learned a great deal about the world, myself, and my potential to be of service to others.

One of the most exciting parts of my time here has been an initiative to build structures (benches, school houses, toilets) out of plastic bottles filled with trash -- an initiative that provides communities with free locally available building materials, while reducing the growing waste problem in the Amazon. It is a very exciting initiative that is now taking off. (See my blog and a video interview about the program)

However, being a woman in an extremely male-dominant culture has been very difficult for me. Not only for the way it has directly affected me, but also seeing how this oppression has shaped the young girls and women here. (You can read a blog entry of mine about this here). As a result, I have become increasingly involved in initiatives to empower women and girls.

So you can imagine my utter delight when I stumbled across this initiative that works with women to learn how to build using naturally-occurring resources – a union of the two themes that I have been most passionate about. I knew right away that this was something I had to be a part of.

Following my Apprenticeship, I plan to work in the Americas to empower women, restore building practices that work in harmony with nature, and build community. My first project will be to build student housing for indigenous scholarship students in Peru. This project will not only utilize natural materials, but also the plastic bottle approach that has worked so well for us until now, only without cement!

However, I need to raise $4,000 toward my participation in the Apprenticeship. Would you be willing to help support my journey into this empowering movement by making a contribution? Any amount, from modest to eye-popping, is welcome and so appreciated!

And in appreciation of your support, I will give those who donate $25 or more an online photo album of the 3 month process. Donations of $125 or more will receive a beautiful tapestry made by a Shipibo women’s artisan group that I have been working with here. And for donations of over $500, we can talk about how I can use my new-found skills to make something for you out of….DIRT! (from small decorations for your house, to perhaps something larger)

I thank you for support, and am so excited to share this journey with you!

Love and thanks,

Amanda

story:
Warning: may stop pipelines and cause spontaneous outbursts of joyous dancing.

21 Sept 2014: We released the #TarFree613 video! http://youtu.be/dXYE6Szi_k0

Solidarity with #PeopleClimateMarch and#PeaceDay2014!

Nov 2013 Update: The shooting of the video is done. Aiming for Summer 2014 release.

10 Oct Update: #TarFree613 track is unleashed! http://velacatalyst.bandcamp.com/track/tarfree613

13 Sept Update: We've started recording! The track will be ready soon!

5 Sept Update: We're funded! THANK YOU! We are so stoked to co-create a music video that will show people saying NO to Tar Sands pipelines and YES to the Future WE define!

What's up?

Like many people in Ottawa, I first heard about the risk of the Tar Sands coming to Canada's capital from an Ecology Ottawa email on 25 June:

"It has just been reported that TransCanada Corp is hoping to build a massive $5 billion pipeline that will transport 850,000 barrels a day of tar sands oil through the south end of the City of Ottawa and across the Rideau River. The plan is to retrofit a natural gas pipeline into a pipeline that will carry crude oil from Alberta’s tar sands to the East Coast of Canada and they want to run the pipeline through our city!" - Ecology Ottawa

This is a Terrible, No Good, Very Bad Idea.

I'm a singer-songwriter called Vela. I'm also a PhD Candidate in Environmental Education nameJulie. As an Artist-Activist, I wanted to help stop this proposed Energy East Pipeline. While sitting in Ecology Ottawa's first public forum about the pipeline on 15 July, I was already writing a song. Then it was announced the twitter hashtag for this campaign is #TarFree613. I thought, "That's a great song title!" 

A few days later while making curry for Kevin Guerette and Rebecca Lantz, we jammed on the #TarFree613 Song. In walked Fedor Ilitchev, who just happens to make videos. Kevin just happens to be a music producer and gifted guitarist. Rebecca just happens to be awesome. We realized that in that one kitchen, we had all the ingredients for an awesome project: to record the song and make a music video that will support Ecology Ottawa, The Council of Canadians, 350 Ottawa, and other fabulous organizations, to help get the message out. Well, all the ingredients except one: cash. So a week later, we shot the live demo of the song for this Indiegogo funding campaign (the Pitch Video, above).

The Tar Sands extraction sites are ugly wounds on Mother Earth. Our Resistance is Beautiful. We need to say "NO!" to the Tar Sands on every front, in every community, in every way we can. Communities need to support each other to be strong enough to shut down the Tar Sands. The #TarFree613 Song is part of this creative, collaborative resistance.

More About the Vision for the Video

Please note the Pitch Video, above, shows what we can do with no funding, and no time. All we had was ourselves, the Mud Lake dock, and a video camera. OK, and a beaver, who graced us with cameo appearances. 

Imagine what we can do with funding, time, and most importantly, YOU! We'd like the video to be collaborative. Here are just the broad strokes of our plan for the #TarFree613 Video, (the timing is using the above Pitch Video): 1. 0:00-24: Begin as a parody of a News Report (the "finding out" part of the Song, opening that email about the Pipeline). 2. 0:24-0:36: First "TarFree613" chorus, maybe have similar images for the chorus each time. For example, we want to shoot on the old pipeline that TransCanada wants to retrofit! 3. 0:37-0:48 "No to this Pipeline" part - show footage of peaceful resistance so far. 4. 1:01- 1:23 "We don't want" part - footage that illustrates all that we don't want (Eg. We don't want... pipeline spills, dead wildlife, corporate greed, etc). 5. 1:24- 1:30 "Bling part" - we wear gold bellbottom pantsuits and so much Shiny Stuff, it will make Lady Gaga blush. We don't need Stuff to be happy! 6. 1:31- 2:08: Now this is your chance to shine!!! For the "What we want" part, we'd like to show YOU and what YOU want our future to be like! And pretty much up until the end of the song, its about focusing on the beautiful, fair, loving future we want, to leave folks feeling inspired and uplifted. And determined to have a TarFree Future! 

Please feel free to post feedback, comments, and ideas about the video in the comment section of the campaign, on the FB Event Wall, or message Vela. If you'd like to be in the video, please email vela.music.project@gmail.com. There will be more details after the funding campaign about collaborating with us. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $600 to pull this off. And YOU can be in our music video!

Budget

  • $350 for studio recording, mixing, and mastering (by Kevin), includes studio rental. To produce radio quality recording to post on bandcamp, ReverbNation, and put on the radio
  • $100 honorarium to videographer (Fedor), to create video to post on youtube & vimeo
  • $100 for props, travel, or other unforeseen costs to make video
  • $50 (approx.) for Indiegogo and PayPal Fees
  • Total: $600

Perky Perks

This is no ordinary music video. This will be co-created with our community! Co-created with YOU. The song invites you to think about the future YOU want. When we first launched, we though a fun Perk would be that if you pitch us $10, we'd include a video clip of you holding a sign that says "We want [insert the wonderful thing you want]". Or holding a "#TarFree613" sign. But as we got more and more excited about having lots and lots of people in the video, we realized we want EVERYONE to be included. We want this video to show the beautiful and inspiring diversity of people working together for the future we want. A TarFree Future! So we do not want money to prevent anyone from participating. We also realized we will continue the call out for folks to be in the video after this funding campaign is over. And it wouldn't be fair to have some folks pay and some not pay. So, instead, please make sure we're fully funded so we can pull this off! Give what you can, and share share share! If you're part of an organization or business, let them know that for $50, individuals or organizations will be listed as a supporter, with a link to their website and logo in video credits, video description, and on the song description (on bandcamp & ReverbNation).

What if we don't reach our funding goal?

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will all cry. Please don't make us cry. And through our tears, we'll still do our best with whatever funds we get.

What if we blow past our funding goal?

If we are blessed with abundance, we will: First, see if the extra money can be further invested into the project (for promotion, entering the song in songwriting contests, or making an even more compelling video). Then second, use the money for more Artivist projects, and donate to local organizations that are working on this issue. 

Financial Transparency

We will produce a financial report of our actual expenses that will be posted and made available to anyone who requests it. We appreciate your trust and will be completely financially transparent with you. We're also curious how much this will really cost, because we want to do it again!

The Impact

Keep Tar Sands Crude out of the 613 area code. Contribute to the overall creative resistance to make the Tar Sands unprofitable. Have lots of fun doing so.

Our track record

  • You can check out some of my previous recordings with Kevin at http://velacatalyst.bandcamp.com
  • You can sample Kevin's awesomeness at http://kevinguerette.com
  • Just trust me that Fedor and Rebecca are a.w.e.s.o.m.e.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make noise about this campaign! Use those nifty Indiegogo share tools! Tweet about #TarFree613!
  • Petitions you can sign here: http://ecologyottawa.nationbuilder.com/tar_sands_oil  and http://www.thepetitionsite.com/takeaction/337/991/686/
  • Learn more about the Energy East Pipeline from Ecology Ottawa at http://tarfree613, and from the Council of Canadians at http://www.canadians.org/energyeast. And this video gives a quick overview about the Tar Sands Industry.
  • Post #TarFree613 pix and suggestions about the video in the Comments section of this campaign or on FB!


Thank You, Merci, Migwech. 

Keep Shining Bright,

Vela (with Kevin, Fedor, & Rebecca)

Reaching out to you from unceded Algonquin Territory.
