story:
History: English and Spanish-Historia en Inglés y Español

INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITIES THREATEN NATIONAL RESERVE OF THE HUMBOLDT PENGUIN IN PUNTA DE CHOROS, CHILI.

We are an environmental movement (Modema) in the commune of la Higuera, Coquimbo Region in the north of Chili, which defends the environmental heritage of the area.

The last habitat of Humboldt Penguins is in danger because of a large mining project.

Between 2007 and 2010 MODEMA effectively paralyzed the building of three coal power plants in the coastal area.

Again we feel obliged to defend our environment and the unique species that live there like Penguins, Sea Otters, Bottlenose dolphins, whales and petrels from industrial activities.

Our environment suffers the menace of a mining company that threatens an area of special ecological interest. The defense of the Penguin Reserve is a noble cause because we face a powerful economic group with the intention to develop 2 large open pit mines and a harbour. We need your support to hire legal counseling to take the mining company to court and demand environmental protection in order to stop the treats to the nearby Penguin Reserve that has a tremendous ecological value.

With your help and campaign funds we must paralyze this badly designed mining project, who by the nature of its activity threatens biodiversity in general and the habitat of the Humboldt penguin in particular.

Story Development.

The Humboldt Current is a cold ocean current that flows in a northern direction along the coast of Chile, Peru and Ecuador. This cold water contains nitrates and phosphates, propitious to phytoplankton and zooplankton which are a key food source for many fish. This current forms an important system of abundant wildlife and marine ecosystems where the Humboldt Penguin National Reserve is located. With 187 species of microalgae and invertebrates, 122 species of birds, 21 species of marine mammals and 68 species of fish, the area comprises 12 habitats of great ecological importance for conservation. The Humboldt Penguin is the threatened species along with other marine wildlife that is endemic to the Humboldt Current.

 The Humboldt Penguin has official protection and is in a vulnerable state of preservation, according to the IUCN 2006 (.....) and Birdlife International. Chile is proud to host 80% of the world population of this important species, of which the largest colony is on the National Reserve (Islas Damas- Choros), sharing their habitat with sea lions, dolphins, whales, sea otters, petrels, cormorants , albatrosses, sharks.

The Dominga mining project entered the System of Environmental Evaluation in September 2013 and has not yet been approved. The project contains two huge open pit mines and a harbour. The Andes Iron Company wants to open up the land for the extraction of iron ore, copper and gold

The shipping terminal will be just 34 km south of the Humboldt Penguin habitat which means that this terminal is in the area of influence of the project.  The predominantly southern winds and northbound current will take any pollutants to the Penguin Reserve in a matter of hours.

We know from experience that the Chilean system is entirely favorable to large investments that threaten the environment. It is imperative to protect the Humboldt Penguin species in their natural environment. This is why MODEMA asks for your help. We need to hire a lawyer to stop the Dominga project by the Andes Iron Company. We do not want to mortgage the future of our grandchildren and let mining companies destroy Protected Areas that are unique in the world. Help us defend the Humboldt Penguin, help us defend your planet.

We need 15,000 USD.

Legal advice is budgeted at 15,000 USD.

If you collaborate, you will be a participant in the protection of a large number of species and you will be named as Official Protector of the Reserve. With your donation we can achieve a global conservation hotspot. With a lot of effort and willpower we have managed to paralyze three major industrial projects in 2007-2010. Now we are facing a multibillion dollar project from a mining company. The Chilean environmental law does not provide sufficient protection against highly polluting projects that threaten valuable ecosystems.

Help us to share this conflict and any contribution is welcome since your support is critical to save hundreds of species. We need your help. The beauty of this place is for everybody and it is our duty to protect it.


Somos MODEMA (Movimiento Defensa del Medio Ambiente) de la Comuna de la Higuera, la Región de Coquimbo. Somos una organización ambiental de interés público que vela por la defensa del patrimonio ambiental de la zona.

Está en peligro el último hábitat de los Pinguinos de Humboldt por un gran proyecto minero.

Modema logró paralizar entre los años 2007 y 2010 tres proyectos termoeléctricos en el borde costero de tres diferentes empresas.  

Otra vez nos vemos en la obligación de defender nuestro entorno y las especies singulares que viven en ella: Pingüinos, Nutrias de mar, Delfines nariz de botella, ballenas, Petreles buceadores.

Una vez más sufrimos el acoso y ambición de los intereses económicos de grandes grupos, que ponen en peligro una zona de especial interés ecológico.

Se trata de una causa noble ya que nos enfrentamos a  un poderoso grupo económico con intención de desarrollo minero y portuario. Por eso necesitamos tu apoyo para poder contratar asesoría jurídica  para poder llevar el proyecto minero a tribunales y exigir una protección medioambiental mayor a la zona, para que de una vez por todas, no vuelva a producirse una amenaza contra un bien ecológico universal tan importante. 

Con tu ayuda y los fondos de la campaña conseguiremos paralizar a éstas empresas sin escrúpulos, que por la naturaleza de sus actividades atentan contra la biodiversidad en general y el Pingüino de Humboldt en especial. 

Desarrollo de la Historia.
La corriente de Humboldt es una corriente oceánica fría que fluye en dirección norte por la costa de Chile, Perú y Ecuador. 
Este agua fría contiene nitratos y fosfatos, de los que se alimenta el fitoplancton y de este a su vez el zooplancton, fundamental fuente nutritiva de muchos peces.
Esta corriente forma un importante conjunto de ecosistemas de abundante flora y fauna y donde se ubica la Reserva Nacional Pingüino de Humboldt.
Con 187 especies de macroalgas e invertebrados, 122 especies de aves, 21 especies de mamímeros marinos y 68 de peces, el área comprende hasta 12 hábitats de enorme importancia ecológica para su conservación. Nuestro protagonista bajo amenaza es el Pingüino de Humboldt, una especie de ave endémica de la corriente del mismo nombre y que, a pesar de que cuenta con la protección que otorga la legislación chilena, se encuentra en estado de conservación vulnerable, según la I.U.C.N. 2006 ( .....) y birdlife international.
Chile tiene el orgullo de acoger al 80% de la población mundial  de esta importante especie, de los cuales la colonia más numerosa se encuentra en la Reserva nacional, compartiendo su hábitat con lobos marinos, delfines, ballenas, nutrias de mar, petreles, cormoranes, albatros,  tiburones y así hasta un total de 398 especies, lo que influyó para que en 1990 esta zona se declarase Reserva Nacional Pingüino de Humboldt.
En septiembre de 2013 ingresa en el Servicio de Evaluación Ambiental del Estado Chileno (SEA) un proyecto de megamineria a cargo de la empresa Andes Iron, para la comuna de la Higuera. Pretenden abrir la tierra para la extracción de Hierro, Cobre y Oro y la construcción de un puerto de embarque y transporte del mineral de la cercana población costera de Totoralillo.
El terminal de embarque se encontraría a tan solo 34 kms al sur del hábitat del Pingüino de Humboldt  que queda en el área de influencia del proyecto por estar a favor del viento y la corriente, que van del sur al norte. Eventuales derrames o introducción de especies exóticas llegarían a la reserva en cuestión de días.
Sabemos por experiencia que el sistema chileno es totalmente favorable a las grandes inversiones que atentan contra el medio ambiente. 
Es imperativo proteger la especie Pingüino de Humboldt en su entorno natural.
Es por esto que MODEMA les pide ayuda.
Necesitamos contratar un abogado para el día que tengamos que demandar judicialmente la aprobación de éste terrible proyecto. 
No queremos hipotecar el futuro de nuestros nietos y destruir Áreas Protegidas que son únicas en el mundo.
Ayúdanos a defender el Pingüino de Humboldt, ayúdanos a defender tu planeta. 

Necesitamos 15,000 USD.

La asesoria jurídica está presupuestada en 15,000 USD para la judicialización del proyecto. 

Si colaboras, serás partícipe en primera persona, de la protección de una gran cantidad de especies y serás nombrado protector oficial del lugar.

Con su donación podremos lograr la conservación de un hotspot mundial. Ya hemos logrado paralizar tres proyectos industriales de gran envergadura a través del lobby con responsabilidad y coherencia. 

Estamos enfrentando un proyecto de miles de millones de dolares y no existen condiciones de igualdad. El Estado Chileno cuenta con leyes favorables para la aprobación de proyectos de este tipo, que son muy contaminantes y que no tienen mecanismos de protección para zonas vulnerables.

Necesitamos tu colaboración para poder llevar el proyecto ante los tribunales.

Difunde, comparte, extiende el conflicto y sobre todo participa con cualquier aportación, ya que tu ayuda es determinante para poder salvar cientos de especies.

Necesitamos tu colaboración. La belleza de éste lugar es de para todos, la lucha para conservarlo es de todos.

The defense of the Penguin Reserve is a noble cause because we face a powerful economic group with the intention to develop 2 large open pit mines and a harbour. We need your support to hire legal counseling to take the mining company to court and demand environmental protection in order to stop the treats to the nearby Penguin Reserve that has a tremendous ecological value.
With your help and campaign funds we must paralyze this badly designed mining project, who by the nature of its activity threatens biodiversity in general and the habitat of the Humboldt penguin in particular.
Story Development.
The Humboldt Current is a cold ocean current that flows in a northern direction along the coast of Chile, Peru and Ecuador. This cold water contains nitrates and phosphates, propitious to phytoplankton and zooplankton which are a key food source for many fish. This current forms an important system of abundant wildlife and marine ecosystems where the Humboldt Penguin National Reserve is located. With 187 species of microalgae and invertebrates, 122 species of birds, 21 species of marine mammals and 68 species of fish, the area comprises 12 habitats of great ecological importance for conservation. The Humboldt Penguin is the threatened species along with other marine wildlife that is endemic to the Humboldt Current.
 The Humboldt Penguin has official protection and is in a vulnerable state of preservation, according to the IUCN 2006 (.....) and Birdlife International. Chile is proud to host 80% of the world population of this important species, of which the largest colony is on the National Reserve (Islas Damas- Choros), sharing their habitat with sea lions, dolphins, whales, sea otters, petrels, cormorants , albatrosses, sharks.
The Dominga mining project entered the System of Environmental Evaluation in September 2013 and has not yet been approved. The project contains two huge open pit mines and a harbour. The Andes Iron Company wants to open up the land for the extraction of iron ore, copper and gold
The shipping terminal will be just 34 km south of the Humboldt Penguin habitat which means that this terminal is in the area of influence of the project.  The predominantly southern winds and northbound current will take any pollutants to the Penguin Reserve in a matter of hours.
We know from experience that the Chilean system is entirely favorable to large investments that threaten the environment. It is imperative to protect the Humboldt Penguin species in their natural environment. This is why MODEMA asks for your help. We need to hire a lawyer to stop the Dominga project by the Andes Iron Company. We do not want to mortgage the future of our grandchildren and let mining companies destroy Protected Areas that are unique in the world. Help us defend the Humboldt Penguin, help us defend your planet.
We need 15,000 USD.
Legal advice is budgeted at 15,000 USD.
If you collaborate, you will be a participant in the protection of a large number of species and you will be named as Official Protector of the Reserve. With your donation we can achieve a global conservation hotspot. With a lot of effort and willpower we have managed to paralyze three major industrial projects in 2007-2010. Now we are facing a multibillion dollar project from a mining company. The Chilean environmental law does not provide sufficient protection against highly polluting projects that threaten valuable ecosystems.
Help us to share this conflict and any contribution is welcome since your support is critical to save hundreds of species. We need your help. The beauty of this place is for everybody and it is our duty to protect it.

Somos MODEMA (Movimiento Defensa del Medio Ambiente) de la Comuna de la Higuera, la Región de Coquimbo. Somos una organización ambiental de interés público que vela por la defensa del patrimonio ambiental de la zona.

Está en peligro el último hábitat de los Pinguinos de Humboldt por un gran proyecto minero.
Modema logró paralizar entre los años 2007 y 2010 tres proyectos termoeléctricos en el borde costero de tres diferentes empresas.  
Otra vez nos vemos en la obligación de defender nuestro entorno y las especies singulares que viven en ella: Pingüinos, Nutrias de mar, Delfines nariz de botella, ballenas, Petreles buceadores.
Una vez más sufrimos el acoso y ambición de los intereses económicos de grandes grupos, que ponen en peligro una zona de especial interés ecológico.
Se trata de una causa noble ya que nos enfrentamos a  un poderoso grupo económico con intención de desarrollo minero y portuario. Por eso necesitamos tu apoyo para poder contratar asesoría jurídica  para poder llevar el proyecto minero a tribunales y exigir una protección medioambiental mayor a la zona, para que de una vez por todas, no vuelva a producirse una amenaza contra un bien ecológico universal tan importante. 
Con tu ayuda y los fondos de la campaña conseguiremos paralizar a éstas empresas sin escrúpulos, que por la naturaleza de sus actividades atentan contra la biodiversidad en general y el Pingüino de Humboldt en especial. 
Desarrollo de la Historia.La corriente de Humboldt es una corriente oceánica fría que fluye en dirección norte por la costa de Chile, Perú y Ecuador. Este agua fría contiene nitratos y fosfatos, de los que se alimenta el fitoplancton y de este a su vez el zooplancton, fundamental fuente nutritiva de muchos peces.Esta corriente forma un importante conjunto de ecosistemas de abundante flora y fauna y donde se ubica la Reserva Nacional Pingüino de Humboldt. Con 187 especies de macroalgas e invertebrados, 122 especies de aves, 21 especies de mamímeros marinos y 68 de peces, el área comprende hasta 12 hábitats de enorme importancia ecológica para su conservación. Nuestro protagonista bajo amenaza es el Pingüino de Humboldt, una especie de ave endémica de la corriente del mismo nombre y que, a pesar de que cuenta con la protección que otorga la legislación chilena, se encuentra en estado de conservación vulnerable, según la I.U.C.N. 2006 ( .....) y birdlife international.Chile tiene el orgullo de acoger al 80% de la población mundial  de esta importante especie, de los cuales la colonia más numerosa se encuentra en la Reserva nacional, compartiendo su hábitat con lobos marinos, delfines, ballenas, nutrias de mar, petreles, cormoranes, albatros,  tiburones y así hasta un total de 398 especies, lo que influyó para que en 1990 esta zona se declarase Reserva Nacional Pingüino de Humboldt.En septiembre de 2013 ingresa en el Servicio de Evaluación Ambiental del Estado Chileno (SEA) un proyecto de megamineria a cargo de la empresa Andes Iron, para la comuna de la Higuera. Pretenden abrir la tierra para la extracción de Hierro, Cobre y Oro y la construcción de un puerto de embarque y transporte del mineral de la cercana población costera de Totoralillo. El terminal de embarque se encontraría a tan solo 34 kms al sur del hábitat del Pingüino de Humboldt  que queda en el área de influencia del proyecto por estar a favor del viento y la corriente, que van del sur al norte. Eventuales derrames o introducción de especies exóticas llegarían a la reserva en cuestión de días.Sabemos por experiencia que el sistema chileno es totalmente favorable a las grandes inversiones que atentan contra el medio ambiente. Es imperativo proteger la especie Pingüino de Humboldt en su entorno natural.Es por esto que MODEMA les pide ayuda.Necesitamos contratar un abogado para el día que tengamos que demandar judicialmente la aprobación de éste terrible proyecto. No queremos hipotecar el futuro de nuestros nietos y destruir Áreas Protegidas que son únicas en el mundo.Ayúdanos a defender el Pingüino de Humboldt, ayúdanos a defender tu planeta.  
  
Necesitamos 15,000 USD.


La asesoria jurídica está presupuestada en 15,000 USD para la judicialización del proyecto. 
Si colaboras, serás partícipe en primera persona, de la protección de una gran cantidad de especies y serás nombrado protector oficial del lugar.

Con su donación podremos lograr la conservación de un hotspot mundial. Ya hemos logrado paralizar tres proyectos industriales de gran envergadura a través del lobby con responsabilidad y coherencia. 

Estamos enfrentando un proyecto de miles de millones de dolares y no existen condiciones de igualdad. El Estado Chileno cuenta con leyes favorables para la aprobación de proyectos de este tipo, que son muy contaminantes y que no tienen mecanismos de protección para zonas vulnerables.

Necesitamos tu colaboración para poder llevar el proyecto ante los tribunales.
Difunde, comparte, extiende el conflicto y sobre todo participa con cualquier aportación, ya que tu ayuda es determinante para poder salvar cientos de especies.
Necesitamos tu colaboración. La belleza de éste lugar es de para todos, la lucha para conservarlo es de todos.

story:
Why the campaign?

If you are fascinated by the incredible diversity of life on this planet and you wish to see it survive the millennium… If you wish to inspire the next generation to protect it… And if you believe that conserving tropical biodiversity in poor countries can and should benefit local communities then read on.

The Maya Mountain Marine Corridor (MMMC) in southern Belize is one of the world’s most unspoiled biodiversity havens. The 3240 km2 landscape/seascape stretches from the pristine old-growth rainforest of the Maya Mountains out to the coral reefs of the Snake Cayes. Each and every ecosystem is still intact, 75% of the MMMC is legally protected and over 90% of its land area is still forested. The landscape supports 49 globally threatened or endangered species including Baird's tapir, jaguar, West Indian manatee and four species of sea turtle.

Historically, the MMMC was inaccessible and had a very low human population density. However, now it has one of the highest population growth rates in Central America and 60% of the population has insufficient income to meet basic requirements for food, clothing and shelter. People want economic development and, not knowing any different, it is easy for them to take for granted the healthy forests, rivers and reefs all around them.

The direction we go from here will very much depend upon the formation of our current generation of children and youths. It is critical that they come to understand the value and importance of the biological treasures of the MMMC and develop the skills and knowledge they will need to develop sustainable economic uses of these resources.

 

Inspiring the youth of the Maya Mountain Marine Corridor to be environmental stewards

Under this project, the Toledo Institute for Development and Environment (TIDE) will provide opportunities for 700 children and adolescents in, and around, the MMMC to develop understanding and appreciation of their amazing natural heritage while engaging in healthy, outdoor activities that empower them to realize their potential.

Three of our main programs in environmental education and outreach are:

  • Freshwater Cup: a football competition with a twist - to participate, each team must successfully complete a socially and environmentally beneficial project in their community. Previous environmental projects have included planting trees to protect riverbanks, painting murals with environmental messages and starting recycling programs. The program fosters teamwork and empowers kids by making them realize what can be accomplished when we work together.

  • Summer Camp: gives primary school children an opportunity to participate in educational outdoor activities during the summer holidays. Children learn to swim, develop teamwork and creative skills and learn about their local environment while having fun. Each one- to two-week camp ends with a field trip to a local national park, fostering a love of nature and building environmental awareness. These trips are extremely successful at engaging children in learning about ecosystems and fostering a love of biodiversity.

  • Youth Conservation Competition: final-year high school students compete for partial university scholarships by writing and performing theatrical presentations to raise awareness of and pride in Belize’s natural heritage. The event not only raises environmental awareness but also empowers young people to explore their capabilities by performing in public. Associate degree scholarships are an attractive incentive for young Belizeans, for many of whom the cost of tuition is a barrier to education. This ensures a high calibre of participation in the competition and helps young people to realize their dreams of higher education.

 

Benefits to children and the environment

Over the last ten years, TIDE has directly engaged over 4,000 children with their local environment. The impacts are already clearly visible in school grounds, which used to be littered with garbage but are now so much cleaner. Teachers report hearing kids telling others not to drop litter and to look after the environment. The impacts should grow as these children, the future farmers, fishermen and decision-makers of the MMMC, carry improved environment consciousness into their adult lives.

Besides greater environmental stewardship, our programs have brought benefits in multiple areas, including: i) gender equality; ii) healthy lifestyles; iii) school performance; and iv) promoting friendship between children of different ethnic groups. Recognizing these benefits to children, UNICEF has helped to support the education and outreach program for the past three years.

Who we are

We are the Toledo Institute for Development and Environment (TIDE), a local grassroots NGO working with communities to promote sustainable use and management of the rich natural resources of the MMMC. Our mission is:

 “To foster community participation in resource management and sustainable use of ecosystems within the Maya Mountain Marine Corridor of southern Belize for the benefit of present and future generations”

Environmental education is a major part of what we do. We also co-manage three protected areas in partnership with the Government of Belize: the Port Honduras Marine Reserve, Payne's Creek National Park and the TIDE Private Protected Lands. We also undertake scientific research and monitoring to inform protected area management and policy. Finally, we build capacity for sustainable economic community development to support the needs of local people who are at the heart of our conservation efforts. For more info on our programs, please visit our website www.tidebelize.org.

 

Where your money will go

Despite our great ongoing projects, we struggle to get money to fund the core costs of the environmental education and outreach department. This year, we need money for two main areas - the Youth Conservation Competition and to continue employing our Environmental Education and Outreach Coordinator without whom, none of the above could happen.

1. $1800 is needed for the associate degree scholarship prizes for the Youth Conservation Competition. The prizes this year will be: 1st place US$750, 2nd place US$500, 3rd place $250 and two runners-up prizes of $150. The prize money is paid directly to the educational institution of the winner’s choice.

2. A further $550 is needed for the Youth Conservation Competition in order to cover the rent of the Parish Hall, the materials to decorate the stage and music for the event.

2. $6786 will ensure we can continue to employ our Environmental Education and Outreach Coordinator for another 6 months, which will allow him to continue his dedicated work towards our amazing projects.

3. The remaining $864 will go towards admin costs that Indiegogo require and ensuring we can fulfil our perks.

If we should be lucky enough to raise any more money:

$250 will cover the costs of marketing for the Youth Conservation Competition

$1131 is needed per month to employ our Environmental Education and Outreach Coordinator

 

TIDE environmental education coordinator, Mr. Norman Budna

Norman has been TIDE’s environmental education and outreach coordinator for eight years, before which he worked as the education officer for the Belize Zoo.

He is passionate about developing his community in a sustainable manner and giving children the chance to discover their natural heritage. He is widely known and well liked in the local communities. During the environmental projects for the Freshwater Cup, a kid was overheard telling their classmate that "Mr. Budna no wan see dat" ("Mr. Budna doesn't want to see that!").

Despite being calm and softly spoken, Mr. Budna has a way of motivating people to get involved in community actions and each year, he mobilizes scores of volunteers to help run the TIDE Summer Camp, Freshwater Cup and carry out beach clean-ups.

 

Other ways you can help

Please share our cause with your friends and family. The more people who know about it, the more likely we are to hit our target.

To keep in touch with goings-on at TIDE please like our Facebook page:  http://www.facebook.com/TIDEBZE or follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/TIDEBelize

Or use the share tools at the top of this page.

For any further information please leave us a comment and we'll get back to you.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
THIS IS OUR LAST CHANCE TO SAVE OUR FURBABIES

On November 17, 2011, we believe out of retaliation, we were raided.  All our animals were illegally seized.  However, that is not the worse part of this.  In order to get charges against me (and my husband) the animal control officer (we believe) tried to kill our cats.  However, he did succeed in doing so by withholding their medication and yes we do have proof of that.

I filed a lawsuit against the animal control officer on 11/30/2011 for the return of my animals, we are still in that lawsuit.   The money we are raising is to pay the past due balance of $3000.  So far the fees  have totaled out over $8000 just on the animals attorney only, this does not include the money we've paid on attorneys for the criminal matter, the money we had to pay to have one of our dogs seen by our vet in May 2012, nor the money for ink, photos, etc to prove our innocence.  This case has cost us financially, mentally and emotionally.

Why We Feel We Were Retaliated Against By This ACO

December 15 2009, CPS visited our house.  This was after the town marshal that lives up the street from us (and he is not the town marshal of my town) got into an argument with me over my horses and he told me he was going to call CPS on me.  Apparently he did.  The caseworker shows up, we went to the office to speak to her, cleared everything up.  She asked my husband and me if we'd agree to her opening a case on us, we said no, she offered to get us funding to finish remodeling our kitchen, we still said no.  On December 21, 2009 she unsubstantiated the allegations against us.

January 6, 2010 (and remember, this is AFTER she unsubstantiated the allegations) she sent that same neighbor (the Town Marshal of the neighboring town) to our house to do a welfare child check due to a couple inches of snow expecting to come through.  He and I get into it again.  He wanted to come into my home, I told him no warrant, no entry.  He had been harassing us for over a year and I just got tired of it. 

January 6, 7, 8, 2010 I spoke with the case worker and each of these days she asked me again if I'd agree to her opening a case on  us, again I said no.

January 11, 2010 she came to the house and I only let her in because I was sick and tired of the harassment and I wanted to set the record straight.  She started off saying the school called her and I told her I knew better than that as I had an open relationship with the school and I just spoke with the principle about my kids the month before and he assured me both kids were doing fine.  Anyway, she started in  on me saying this cat had feline leukemia, this cat was ill, that cat had that this or that.  I was like, whoa, I am a former vet tech, I know what I am doing and the cats were under a vets care.  Then she started in on me about homeschooling Parker.  I had to set her straight about that as she did not know any of the legalities of homeschooling in Indiana.  Feeling we got everything laid out and explained she then again asked me if we'd agree to her opening a case on us and again we said no.  She said she could get us funding for new flooring, kitchen cabinets, etc.  we still said no.  She then left.

January 13, 2010, she, her boss, and 2 deputies arrive and tell me they were there to detain my children to a motel at my expense, not into foster care and that she called animal control.  Animal control arrived, stood in my living room for 20 minutes commending me on a job well done.  We went over a few things.  As he went to leave he looked over at the caseworker as if to say goodbye and said he would be back the next day to seize the cats, but I could keep the dog and the chicken (both were house pets, the chicken was not full grown nor fully feathered).  When I asked why he was going to seize the cats he said to help me with my CPS case.  I told him I wanted to speak to my vet before he took any animal from my home and he said I had to do it before he come back the next day.  I did call my vet but she didn't get back with me until January 15, 2010.

January 14, 2010 animal control came back out to seize the cats.

June 2010.  In February 2010, this caseworker who fabricated a cat hoarding story was taken off the case and a new one was assigned (this is how all cases play out).  When Tawana took over I told her repeatidly the lies that Shannon had said and that the cats were cared for.  She even got the educational neglect dropped from the case as well because I too had to educate her and she realized I was right.  She told me if we could prove we were not cat hoarders by providing to her vet bills they'd dismiss the case.  I gave her the receipts I could find which totaled over $1500 for an 18 month period.  She got the case dismissed.  At this point we began waiting for the bench warrant to see the judge over the cats.  That never happened.

After digging and doing research I filed a tort claim on February 28, 2011 against the ACO, the animal control, commissioners and the county council.  The commissioners had 90 days to accept, deny or ignore the claim.  If they denied or ignored it, it meant I then could bring forth the suit in court.

This is when we started noticing odd things beginning to happen..

Sept 24,2011 I was asked to take cats from another kill shelter,  however I was not int he position to do so, so I didn't.

Oct 28, 2011 my horses were stolen by the same deputy that was part of the 2010 cps case.  I was told he was going to file abuse charges with the prosecutor.  Prosecutor just said for me to make my paddock bigger.  Which is was already too big and was not any bigger for specific reasons.

November 15, 2011 I was asked by another No Kill to help a woman in Louisville, KY who was going to get evicted over her cats if they were not removed.  I told her I wasn't in a situation to help, but I thought about it, what would I want someone to do if it were me.  I helped to prevent her from being evicted and to move the cats as her neighbor was shooting them with a bb gun.  Helping her is what got me raided.

There are TOO many "coincidences" for it not to be all tied in.  There is a pattern here also that I cannot say yet either. 

The Defamation, The Rumors

Our children are now 20, 19 and 16 years old (Josh, Candace and Parker).  They  have literally lost 3 1/2 years of their lives because of animal control and CPS.  And it's not fair.  Parker has lost not just his cats from 2010 but Sagwa, Garfield, Izzie and Zim in 2011 and 2012.  We have many supporters only because they  have chosen to listen to our side.  Our side has never been sugar coated, we have never lied, we have been honest and upfront with each and every person that has asked what our side was.  We have nothing to hide.

The media was brought into this not to tell about a "hoarder posing as a rescue" as the ACO said about me but to defame me to get everyone to turn against me. I am not a hoarder, nor did I pose as a rescue, I do own a rescue, I do believe in no kill, I do believe in helping whenever I can.  This ACO  boasted in June 2013 how our county has a 70% kill rate and then in September that it went up to 94% and the commissioners have said his "Operation Dog Gone" is a success.  Well I don't think 94% killing rate is a success when just months before it was lower.

At no point have I ever been a hoarder, at no point have I ever harmed an animal and at no point have my children ever been put in harms way.  However, at the time of the raid we were dealing with a flooded basement.  In which we had forced Josh (our oldest child)  out of his bedroom (which was in the basement) due to the flooding issue.  We had been moving items out of the basement to fix it come tax time in 2012.  We had been purging attics to fit items we didn't normally use and getting rid of items we no longer needed trying to make space for Josh to have a some sort of  bedroom in the living room, in which to do so we had to do away with much of our living room furniture.  We had no where else for him to go, but he was not going to remain in the basement at that point.  What people are not understanding is that Josh was legally an adult and I still FORCED him out of that room for safety reasons.  But yet I am being  bad mouthed by people claiming that because they saw in the media that I FORCED Candace or Parker to sleep in the basement therefore it is true and that is a big bold faced lie and the ones that said it know it and I can prove they knew it by the statement and comments that the ACO and the deputy said about Candace and Parker's bedrooms.  And why would I force my 2 younger children to sleep in a bedroom or basement that I forced their adult brother out of, especially when they had their own bedrooms on the main floor?  So to keep my house clean was I supposed to make Josh live in the basement, just throw everything in the basement in the garbage?  Or was I supposed to do what any parent, home owner would do, move my son out of the basement and try to salvage what we could?

Another issue in the media is the so called "floors covered in feces" and "we have pictures of feces on the beds.." that also is not true.   I can also explain that.  The night before the raid I went to bed at 11 pm (not to sleep,just laid down for the night waiting for my husband to call me) this was after I checked the main floor litter boxes.  The litter boxes were ok for the night.  Imagine for a moment, 27 cats in your home, in a 1500 sq foot open floor plan home (this is just the main floor and upstairs, not the full size basement).  There was plenty of room for 27 cats, but you have to stay on top of the litter boxes, everyone knows that, and it's not hard to do.  Figure up the hours.  11 pm to 5:30 pm not one litter box touched on the main floor.  Not because I didn't want to, but because I got up around 10 am or so the day of the raid, began doing my chores which was cleaning the upstairs litter boxes and by noon found out we were being staked out.  Since we were also fall cleaning to get ready for Christmas decorations I had taken my curtains off the living room window, the deputy and town marshal (yes, same one from 2010) were walking around my yard and porch for a good hour and a half, so any chores needing to be done on the main floor were unable to even begin for that day.  There was no feces as the media reports all over the floors nor on any bed in my home and there are no pictures of feces on my bed or any bed for that matter.  There was feces outside the litter boxes on the main floor because we were staked out and could not tend to our daily chores and that can  happen with just 1 cat.  The floor was dirty from dragging up wet and dirty items from the basement, no it had not been mopped because we were not done,we were actually behind on getting things done because I had to take Josh to the doctor on Nov 14, 2011, had to take a cat to the vet same day and had to take Josh to a  school event on Nov 16, 2011 and I just had not had a chance to mop, and I mopped after we had finished that week of bringing items up and putting them away.  It was either put my child and a few cats first or keep my house nice and tidy.  I chose to put my kids and my cats first of whom had to go to the doctor, my chores would always be there, their health may not.

The Charges

The arrest charges stem from lack of veterinary care.  However, I am not the person that withheld veterinary care, the ACO is.  I provided animal control with the medication I got from my vet on November 14, 2011 and November 16, 2011.  I directed them who got what and that my vet wanted all the cats on L Lysine, I had ordered it (from that same vet that saw Kenya on 11/14/11) but it had not came in yet.  The ACO withheld all my medication.  The contracted vet ordered medication on 11/18/11 and the ACO withheld that also.  The ACO said that his vet told him to not give them the medication until after the bloodwork came back.  However, that vet said he would not of done that.   The first one that died was 9 days after the raid, she was an 8 week old kitten.  The next 2 were euthanized on day 11 and 12.  The ACO vet said these cats Sagwa and Garfield were euthanzied due to the fact that animal control could not afford to vet them for their illness, an illness that the ACO apparently caused.  Sagwa was watched for 30 minutes having a seizure, in which in stead of providing a trip to the vets office to be put on Valium the ACO (who had the ultimate last say on whether or not an animal lives or dies in his care) said to euthanize her.  Garfield was said to be suffering, lethargic, had a bad URI, had blood tinged pus coming from his mouth.  Instead of providing vet care, he too was just euthanzied.  His illness came from not being medicated for a URI when I told them what my vet wanted my cats to have.  The 4th charge came from an adoption cat.  December 8, 2011, they note on her chart "no appetite".  Abbigayle at no point was ever vetted for anorexia or depression from being ripped away from us, she was starved to death for 8 days.  December 14,  2011 they found her dead in the cage. My husband and I got charged for the deaths of these cats.   As you can clearly see, there was no probable cause at all to charge us let alone arrest us.  These cats, 2 of which were my sons beloved pets died at the hands of a monster, someone that chose to use the animals lives against me because I stood my ground against his actions in 2010.  He has no right to use the law against anyone like he did my family.

Saving The Animals

We are getting ready to go to court to see the judge for our final chance to get our pets home.  Every hearing costs us $1000.  I will fight until I have no fight left, our animals WANT to come home and we want them home more than anyone knows.  But because I have been shunned by most of the rescue community by the rumors and defamation, my donations are very low, I can't have local fundraisers because my "haters" get them canceled and the ones they are hurting are my animals and my children.  Fundraisers to raise the money for the animals attorney fund has been canceled which has caused us to really hold back the power we have to see this through because this is such a complex case and our attorney charges a lot per hour and the case in the past few months has really developed against the parties suing us for criminal actions.

June 2012, 7 months in animal controls care, Izzie, Parker's love of his life fell over dead from a seizure (cat # 2 with a seizure in the aco's care).  November 2012 1 year after the raid, Parker's rooster Zim died.  If we do not get these animals home he will kill every one of them out of spite.  He doesn't care about animals and he really does not care about mine.

Please help us raise the $3000 that we owe the animals attorney so he can move forth to prepare for the final hearing.  This case has been going on too long to just stop now.  Our animals deserve the community to fight for them and get them home.

If you do not believe my side, before judging me, please look at the evidence, it proves I am innocent.

Thank you,

Samantha, Randell, Josh, Candace and Parker
story_txt:
THIS IS OUR LAST CHANCE TO SAVE OUR FURBABIESOn November 17, 2011, we believe out of retaliation, we were raided.  All our animals were illegally seized.  However, that is not the worse part of this.  In order to get charges against me (and my husband) the animal control officer (we believe) tried to kill our cats.  However, he did succeed in doing so by withholding their medication and yes we do have proof of that.
I filed a lawsuit against the animal control officer on 11/30/2011 for the return of my animals, we are still in that lawsuit.   The money we are raising is to pay the past due balance of $3000.  So far the fees  have totaled out over $8000 just on the animals attorney only, this does not include the money we've paid on attorneys for the criminal matter, the money we had to pay to have one of our dogs seen by our vet in May 2012, nor the money for ink, photos, etc to prove our innocence.  This case has cost us financially, mentally and emotionally.
Why We Feel We Were Retaliated Against By This ACO
 December 15 2009, CPS visited our house.  This was after the town marshal that lives up the street from us (and he is not the town marshal of my town) got into an argument with me over my horses and he told me he was going to call CPS on me.  Apparently he did.  The caseworker shows up, we went to the office to speak to her, cleared everything up.  She asked my husband and me if we'd agree to her opening a case on us, we said no, she offered to get us funding to finish remodeling our kitchen, we still said no.  On December 21, 2009 she unsubstantiated the allegations against us.
January 6, 2010 (and remember, this is AFTER she unsubstantiated the allegations) she sent that same neighbor (the Town Marshal of the neighboring town) to our house to do a welfare child check due to a couple inches of snow expecting to come through.  He and I get into it again.  He wanted to come into my home, I told him no warrant, no entry.  He had been harassing us for over a year and I just got tired of it.  
January 6, 7, 8, 2010 I spoke with the case worker and each of these days she asked me again if I'd agree to her opening a case on  us, again I said no.
January 11, 2010 she came to the house and I only let her in because I was sick and tired of the harassment and I wanted to set the record straight.  She started off saying the school called her and I told her I knew better than that as I had an open relationship with the school and I just spoke with the principle about my kids the month before and he assured me both kids were doing fine.  Anyway, she started in  on me saying this cat had feline leukemia, this cat was ill, that cat had that this or that.  I was like, whoa, I am a former vet tech, I know what I am doing and the cats were under a vets care.  Then she started in on me about homeschooling Parker.  I had to set her straight about that as she did not know any of the legalities of homeschooling in Indiana.  Feeling we got everything laid out and explained she then again asked me if we'd agree to her opening a case on us and again we said no.  She said she could get us funding for new flooring, kitchen cabinets, etc.  we still said no.  She then left.
January 13, 2010, she, her boss, and 2 deputies arrive and tell me they were there to detain my children to a motel at my expense, not into foster care and that she called animal control.  Animal control arrived, stood in my living room for 20 minutes commending me on a job well done.  We went over a few things.  As he went to leave he looked over at the caseworker as if to say goodbye and said he would be back the next day to seize the cats, but I could keep the dog and the chicken (both were house pets, the chicken was not full grown nor fully feathered).  When I asked why he was going to seize the cats he said to help me with my CPS case.  I told him I wanted to speak to my vet before he took any animal from my home and he said I had to do it before he come back the next day.  I did call my vet but she didn't get back with me until January 15, 2010.
January 14, 2010 animal control came back out to seize the cats. 
June 2010.  In February 2010, this caseworker who fabricated a cat hoarding story was taken off the case and a new one was assigned (this is how all cases play out).  When Tawana took over I told her repeatidly the lies that Shannon had said and that the cats were cared for.  She even got the educational neglect dropped from the case as well because I too had to educate her and she realized I was right.  She told me if we could prove we were not cat hoarders by providing to her vet bills they'd dismiss the case.  I gave her the receipts I could find which totaled over $1500 for an 18 month period.  She got the case dismissed.  At this point we began waiting for the bench warrant to see the judge over the cats.  That never happened.
After digging and doing research I filed a tort claim on February 28, 2011 against the ACO, the animal control, commissioners and the county council.  The commissioners had 90 days to accept, deny or ignore the claim.  If they denied or ignored it, it meant I then could bring forth the suit in court.
This is when we started noticing odd things beginning to happen..
Sept 24,2011 I was asked to take cats from another kill shelter,  however I was not int he position to do so, so I didn't.
Oct 28, 2011 my horses were stolen by the same deputy that was part of the 2010 cps case.  I was told he was going to file abuse charges with the prosecutor.  Prosecutor just said for me to make my paddock bigger.  Which is was already too big and was not any bigger for specific reasons.
November 15, 2011 I was asked by another No Kill to help a woman in Louisville, KY who was going to get evicted over her cats if they were not removed.  I told her I wasn't in a situation to help, but I thought about it, what would I want someone to do if it were me.  I helped to prevent her from being evicted and to move the cats as her neighbor was shooting them with a bb gun.  Helping her is what got me raided. 
There are TOO many "coincidences" for it not to be all tied in.  There is a pattern here also that I cannot say yet either.  
The Defamation, The Rumors
Our children are now 20, 19 and 16 years old (Josh, Candace and Parker).  They  have literally lost 3 1/2 years of their lives because of animal control and CPS.  And it's not fair.  Parker has lost not just his cats from 2010 but Sagwa, Garfield, Izzie and Zim in 2011 and 2012.  We have many supporters only because they  have chosen to listen to our side.  Our side has never been sugar coated, we have never lied, we have been honest and upfront with each and every person that has asked what our side was.  We have nothing to hide.The media was brought into this not to tell about a "hoarder posing as a rescue" as the ACO said about me but to defame me to get everyone to turn against me. I am not a hoarder, nor did I pose as a rescue, I do own a rescue, I do believe in no kill, I do believe in helping whenever I can.  This ACO  boasted in June 2013 how our county has a 70% kill rate and then in September that it went up to 94% and the commissioners have said his "Operation Dog Gone" is a success.  Well I don't think 94% killing rate is a success when just months before it was lower.

to bed at 11 pm (not to sleep,just laid down for the night waiting for my husband to call me) this was after I checked the main floor litter boxes.  The litter boxes were ok for the night.  Imagine to stay on top of the litter boxes, everyone knows that, and it's not hard to do.  Figure up the hours.  11 pm to 5:30 pm not one litter box touched on the main floor.  Not because I didn't want to, but because I got up around 10 am or so the day of the raid, began doing my chores which was cleaning the upstairs litter boxes and by noon found out we were being staked out.  Since we were also fall cleaning to get ready for Christmas decorations I had taken my curtains off the living room window, the deputy and town marshal (yes, same one from 2010) were walking around my yard and porch for a good hour and a half, so any chores needing to be done on the main floor were unable to even begin for that day.  There was no feces as the media reports all over the floors nor on any bed in my home and there are no pictures of feces on my bed or any bed for that matter.  There was feces outside the litter boxes on the main floor because we were staked out and could not tend to our daily chores and that can  happen with just 1 cat.  The floor was dirty from dragging up wet and dirty items from the basement, no it had not been mopped because we were not done,we were actually behind on getting things done because I had to take Josh to the doctor on Nov 14, 2011, had to take a cat to the vet same day and had to take Josh to a  school event on Nov 16, 2011 and I just had not had a chance to story:
Background

As a two time cancer survivor, I understand how meaningful it is to have the support of family and friends.  Tasha, our Lhasa Poo, was my constant companion and brought me comfort throughout my treatment.  I want to be part of bringing the same joy to children with cancer or other chronic diseases in hospitals.  Brandi is a Cavapoo who adores children.  She has already received her Good Canine Citizen Certificate.  She is ready to continue her training to become a Pet Partners Certified therapy dog.

What We Need

I need to raise $500 to meet our goal.  The $500 would go towards:

  • $70 for online training manual and test
  • $190 for therapy class
  • $35 for the test
  • $95 to be certified by Pet Partners
  • $110 for advanced training class

story:
STOP PRESS -- WE HAVE SUCCESSFULLY SECURED AN EXTENSION TO OUR DEADLINE IN ORDER TO ENSURE WE MEET OUR TARGET, GIVE PEOPLE MORE TIME TO CONTRIBUTE AND RAISE ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO LOOK AT THE VIABILITY OF PROVIDING A SUBTITLING PACKAGE. THE NEW DEADLINE IS MIDNIGHT GMT THURSDAY 11TH JUNE 2015.

Emergence - in association with Resurgence Magazine, Schumacher College, Culture Colony and Volcano Theatre - is making a landmark documentary series of 6 hour-long conversations with Satish Kumar, one of the greatest living teachers and visionaries of the 21st century - and we want you to help us make it happen.

From April 27th to May 29th 2015, we are running our first crowdfunding campaign to raise £25,000 to enable us to fully fund and support the team who will be making, editing, producing and distributing these groundbreaking documentaries. 

Who is Satish Kumar?

Born in 1936, Satish became a Jain Monk at the age of 9 and then, at the age of 18, joined the Gandhian non-violent land reform movement. In 1964 his 8,000 mile, Peace Walk took him from Delhi to all the nuclear capitals of the world, without a penny in his pocket, carrying only a message of peace.

He later settled in the UK and went on to become Editor of Resurgence Magazine, championing ecology, art and spirituality. He founded the world’s leading college for activists and change-makers, Schumacher College, now celebrating its 25th anniversary.
 
“Satish is a truly remarkable manifestation of the human spirit. Working at the juncture of curiosity and compassion, he's inspired so many to do so much!” Bill McKibben, founder 350.org


“Visionary, earthy, filled with wonder - Satish Kumar and his work holds a door of possibility towards a future worth serving.”Martin Shaw, West Country School of Myth.

In his tireless teaching, writing and speaking over eight decades, Satish has changed countless lives. But never before has there been a record of his life and work that deeply investigates all that he stands for and advocates.

Why make a documentary series?

We live in extreme and scary times, yet we lack the political leadership we need to bring our planet back from the brink of ecological, social and economic crisis. This situation leaves many of us feeling isolated and disempowered. The message at the heart of Satish’s teaching is that individuals can and do change the world for the better. He is a living example of Gandhi’s maxim that we should “be the change we want to see in the world”. At times like these, we all need to be inspired to change – and Satish is one of the most inspirational teachers the world has ever seen.

Satish advocates a holistic, spiritual, nature-based philosophy, placing human beings back into our rightful context as an integral part of natural systems and not their masters - as economic 'realists' would have it...

'Kumar has no time for realists. "Is my approach unrealistic?" he asks. "Look at what realists have done for us. They have led us to war and climate change, poverty on an unimaginable scale, and wholesale ecological destruction. Half of humanity goes to bed hungry because of all the realistic leaders in the world. I tell people who call me 'unrealistic' to show me what their realism has done. Realism is an outdated, overplayed and wholly exaggerated concept."'John Vidal - Guardian article

Satish's philosophy is radical yet timeless, revolutionary and yet utterly simple:

"We need to embrace all of society. We need to solve social problems of poverty and wars with imagination, compassion, creativity and forgiveness. All problems can be solved by negotiation, friendship, giving in, letting go of ego and going into eco. Let us make a shift from self-interest to mutual-interest of whole human society. If we can have a holistic view of soil, soul and society, if we can understand the interdependence of all living beings, and understand that all living creatures – from trees to worms to humans – depend on each other, then we can live in harmony with ourselves, with other people and with nature." Satish Kumar - Guardian article

In making this series, we want to bring Satish’s words and teachings to as wide an audience as possible and, at the same time, create a legacy of his lifetime of learning for generations to come. This won’t be a hagiography, a simple glorification of a man’s life and work. We will challenge Satish to communicate his philosophy as never before through six hours of intense, enlightening and enriching conversations.

Emergence - who are we?

Emergence is an arts and sustainability collective based in Wales. We make art with one agenda: to change the world. 

Co-created by theatre-maker Fern Smith in 2010 in response to a growing concern that the arts are simply not responding to the environmental and spiritual crisis that human life is causing all across our world, Emergence advocates creative practice for a sustainable future through hosting artful events and gatherings. We commission artworks, host conferences and workshops, create land journeys and pilgrimages, write and publish documents and reports - all addressing the key issue of our time: the art of living well within the ecological limits of a finite planet. 

We work collectively, collaboratively, holistically and, above all, emergently - trusting in synchronicity, the power of natural systems and a values-based approach to "making art as if the world matters". 

Satish Kumar is one of the main inspirations behind Emergence and his philosophy and activism continue to inspire everything we do. 

What will the series be like?
We live in the age of the sound-bite, short attention spans and ‘quick-fix’ culture. We want this series to be the opposite of that – an opportunity to spend quality time in Satish’s company. The series will present Satish in deep conversation to really draw out his ideas and stories. We will film the first five interviews in the intimate, relaxed surroundings of Satish's home in Devon. The final interview will be filmed before a live audience at Schumacher College near Totnes, where Satish has been teaching and inspiring for over twenty five years. Backers have the chance to attend this interview, meet Satish and be part of the conversation. 

To ensure rigour of debate, we have chosen as our interviewer Jane Davidson, a teacher and activist, and also former Minister for the Environment and Sustainability in Wales - the woman behind the radical One Planet One Wales initiative.

Amongst the many legacies of Jane’s time in post, Wales is now committed to sustainability as a core organizing principle making it the first government in the world to take such a stance. Jane is really looking forward to the conversations with Satish, keen to find ways of drawing out his ideas and bringing them firmly into the mainstream. Jane and Satish share the same values and ideals yet approach them from very different viewpoints. These conversations are sure to be a terrific meeting of minds that will bring real insight into the huge challenges we all face and offer thoughtful, practical ways to change things for the better.

Where will the money go?

The target sum of £25,000 is broken down like this:

Production & Direction – 27%, includes developing the concept, research, building partnerships, logistics and scheduling.

Shooting & Editing – 21%, includes filming, camera and sound crew, all equipment hire, editing and insurances.

Graphics, Design & Packaging – 29%, includes title sequence and menu, DVD copying and packaging.

Travel & Accommodation – 13%, for production team and crew.

Fees & Subsistence – 8%, towards featured contributors.

Marketing – 2%, includes publicity and advertising.



In the extraordinary event that we exceed our target, we will use the money to pay for a multilingual subtitle package for the documentaries, enabling even more people world-wide to be moved and inspired by Satish's words.

What will you get for your support?

These six hour-long documentaries will be filmed in summer 2015 and released as a limited edition, beautifully presented, DVD box-set in autumn 2016 – Satish’s 80th year and the 50th Anniversary of Resurgence.

By supporting our campaign and investing in the project, backers will be literally pre-ordering their copy of the documentaries – either by HD digital download or the DVDs - and we’ve also put together a terrific package of perks, including signed copies of Satish's latest book, 'Soil, Soul, Society',

There are also places at the Resurgence Summer Gathering, a joyous festival of ideas and inspiration held every year in rural Worcestershire, attended by Satish.

In addition, there is the chance to attend the final interview, stay at Schumacher College or even to become one of our producers! This is a strictly not-for-profit project. All monies raised will go into making it happen.

PLEASE SUPPORT US IN MAKING THESE DOCUMENTARIES AND SHARING THE WORK OF THIS EXTRAORDINARY MAN.

THANK YOU FROM ALL OF US!

Fern, Phil & Esyllt
story_txt:
STOP PRESS -- WE HAVE SUCCESSFULLY SECURED AN EXTENSION TO OUR DEADLINE IN ORDER TO ENSURE WE MEET OUR TARGET, GIVE PEOPLE MORE TIME TO CONTRIBUTE AND RAISE ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO LOOK AT THE VIABILITY OF PROVIDING A SUBTITLING PACKAGE. THE NEW DEADLINE IS MIDNIGHT GMT THURSDAY 11TH JUNE 2015.Emergence - in association with Resurgence Magazine, Schumacher College, Culture Colony and Volcano Theatre - is making a landmark documentary series of 6
hour-long conversations with Satish Kumar, one of
the greatest living teachers and visionaries of the 21st century - and
we want you to help us make it happen.
From April 27th to
May 29th 2015, we are running our first crowdfunding campaign to raise £25,000 to enable us to fully fund and support the team who will be making, editing, producing and distributing these groundbreaking documentaries. Who is Satish Kumar?
Born in 1936, Satish became a Jain Monk at the age of 9 and then, at the age of 18, joined the Gandhian
non-violent land reform movement. In 1964 his 8,000 mile, Peace Walk took him from Delhi to
all the nuclear capitals of the world, without a penny in his pocket, carrying
only a message of peace.

He later settled in the UK and went on to become Editor of Resurgence
Magazine, championing ecology, art and spirituality. He founded the
world’s leading college for activists and change-makers, Schumacher College, now celebrating
its 25th anniversary.  

“Satish is a truly remarkable manifestation of the human spirit.
Working at the juncture of curiosity and compassion, he's inspired so many to
do so much!” Bill
McKibben, founder 350.org






“Visionary, earthy, filled with wonder - Satish Kumar and his work
holds a door of possibility towards a future worth serving.”Martin Shaw, West Country School of Myth.

In his tireless teaching, writing and speaking over eight decades,
Satish has changed countless lives. But never before has there been a record of
his life and work that deeply investigates all that he stands for and advocates.
Why make a documentary
series?
We live in extreme and scary times, yet we lack the political
leadership we need to bring our planet back from the brink of ecological,
social and economic crisis. This situation leaves many of us feeling isolated
and disempowered. The message at the heart of Satish’s teaching is that
individuals can and do change the world for the better. He is a living example
of Gandhi’s maxim that we should “be the change we want to see in the world”.
At times like these, we all need to be inspired to change – and Satish is one
of the most inspirational teachers the world has ever seen.
Satish advocates a holistic, spiritual, nature-based philosophy, placing human beings back into our rightful context as an integral part of natural systems and not their masters - as economic 'realists' would have it...
'Kumar has no time for realists. "Is my approach unrealistic?" he asks. "Look at what realists have done for us. They have led us to war and climate change, poverty on an unimaginable scale, and wholesale ecological destruction. Half of humanity goes to bed hungry because of all the realistic leaders in the world. I tell people who call me 'unrealistic' to show me what their realism has done. Realism is an outdated, overplayed and wholly exaggerated concept."'John Vidal - Guardian article

Satish's philosophy is radical yet timeless, revolutionary and yet utterly simple:
"We need to embrace all of society. We need to solve social problems of poverty and wars with imagination, compassion, creativity and forgiveness. All problems can be solved by negotiation, friendship, giving in, letting go of ego and going into eco. Let us make a shift from self-interest to mutual-interest of whole human society. If we can have a holistic view of soil, soul and society, if we can understand the interdependence of all living beings, and understand that all living creatures – from trees to worms to humans – depend on each other, then we can live in harmony with ourselves, with other people and with nature." Satish Kumar - Guardian article
In making this series, we want to bring Satish’s words and teachings
to as wide an audience as possible and, at the same time, create a legacy of
his lifetime of learning for generations to come. This won’t be a hagiography,
a simple glorification of a man’s life and work. We will challenge Satish to
communicate his philosophy as never before through six hours of intense,
enlightening and enriching conversations.
Emergence - who are we?

Emergence is an arts and sustainability collective based in Wales. We make art with one agenda: to change the world. 

Co-created by theatre-maker Fern Smith in 2010 in response to a growing concern that the arts are simply not responding to the environmental and spiritual crisis that human life is causing all across our world, Emergence advocates creative practice for a sustainable future through hosting artful events and gatherings. We commission artworks, host conferences and workshops, create land journeys and pilgrimages, write and publish documents and reports - all addressing the key issue of our time: the art of living well within the ecological limits of a finite planet. 
We work collectively, collaboratively, holistically and, above all, emergently - trusting in synchronicity, the power of natural systems and a values-based approach to "making art as if the world matters". 
Satish Kumar is one of the main inspirations behind Emergence and his philosophy and activism continue to inspire everything we do. 
What will the series be
like?

We live in the age of the sound-bite, short attention spans and
‘quick-fix’ culture. We want this series to be the opposite of that – an
opportunity to spend quality time in Satish’s company. The series will present
Satish in deep conversation to really draw out his ideas and stories. We will film the first five interviews in the intimate, relaxed surroundings of Satish's home in Devon. The final interview will be filmed before a live audience at Schumacher College near Totnes, where Satish has been teaching and inspiring for over twenty five years. Backers have the chance to attend this interview, meet Satish and be part of the conversation. 

To ensure rigour of debate, we have chosen as our interviewer Jane Davidson, a teacher and activist, and also
former Minister for the Environment and Sustainability in Wales - the woman
behind the radical One Planet One Wales initiative.



Amongst the many legacies of Jane’s time in post, Wales is now
committed to sustainability as a core organizing principle making it the first government
in the world to take such a stance. Jane is really looking forward to the
conversations with Satish, keen to find ways of drawing out his ideas and bringing
them firmly into the mainstream. Jane and Satish share the same values and
ideals yet approach them from very different viewpoints. These conversations
are sure to be a terrific meeting of minds that will bring real insight into
the huge challenges we all face and offer thoughtful, practical ways to
change things for the better.


Where will the money go?

The target sum of £25,000 is broken down like this:
Production & Direction – 27%, includes developing the
concept, research, building partnerships, logistics and scheduling.
Shooting & Editing – 21%, includes filming, camera and
sound crew, all equipment hire, editing and insurances.
Graphics, Design & Packaging – 29%, includes title
sequence and menu, DVD copying and packaging.
Travel & Accommodation – 13%, for production team and
crew.
Fees & Subsistence – 8%, towards featured contributors. 
Marketing – 2%, includes publicity and advertising.






In the extraordinary event that we exceed our target, we will use the money to pay for a multilingual subtitle package for the documentaries, enabling even more people world-wide to be moved and inspired by Satish's words.

What will you get for your support?
These six hour-long documentaries will be filmed in summer 2015 and released as a limited edition, beautifully presented, DVD box-set in autumn 2016 – Satish’s 80th year and the 50th Anniversary of Resurgence.
By supporting our
campaign and investing in the project, backers will be literally pre-ordering
their copy of the documentaries – either by HD digital download or the DVDs - and we’ve
also put together a terrific package of perks, including signed copies of Satish's latest book, 'Soil, Soul, Society',



There are also places at the Resurgence Summer Gathering, a joyous festival of ideas and inspiration held every year in rural Worcestershire, attended by Satish.



In addition, there is the chance to attend the final interview, stay at Schumacher College or even to become one of our producers! This is a strictly not-for-profit project. All monies raised will
go into making it happen.
PLEASE SUPPORT US IN MAKING THESE DOCUMENTARIES AND SHARING THE WORK OF THIS EXTRAORDINARY MAN.
THANK YOU FROM ALL OF US!



Fern, Phil & Esyllt

story:
Hope spots to save the oceans!

Hello! This is Valentina and this year for my birthday I don't want gifts, but I'm asking you to help me on a mission: to create hope spots! 

They are networks of marine protected areas, which have loads of benefits. Hope spots:

  • give ocean wildlife a chance to recover
  • maintain healthy biodiversity
  • support habitats that act as carbon sinks
  • remove CO2 from the atmosphere
  • generate the majority of atmospheric oxygen
  • allow low-impact activities like ecotourism to thrive! 

We can do this together by supporting Mission Blue. 

In 2014 only 3% of the ocean was protected, but we can do more, and we should act now!

The world’s oceans are in crisis:

  • 50% of coral reefs have died since 1950
  • 90% of the world’s large fish stocks are gone
  • Up to 40% of fish caught today are caught by accident and wasted. Vulnerable sharks, dolphins, whales and sea turtles are killed in the process.
  • Since 1947, 30'000 oil drilling sites have been created.

We need to protect oceans from industrial fishing, drilling and dumping.

Hope spots can make a real difference, as in Cabo Pulmo (Mexico). In the 1980s fish stock was almost down to zero due to industrial fishing. But in 1997 marine conservation areas have been created, and now fish biomass in Cabo Pulmo constitutes the highest recovery of any marine reserve in the world, and it is a thriving ecoturism spot.

Mission blue was created by Sylvia Earle, a marine biologist, explorer, author and lecturer. She is a real legend. She was the leader of the first all-female team of aquanauts in a project (Tektite II), where the scientists lived under water for weeks at a time. In 1979, she set the women’s depth record of 381 metres walking untethered on the sea floor. In 1990, she was the first woman to be appointed as a chief scientist at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. At present she is explorer-in-residence at the National Geographic Society. And in 2009 she won a TED prize, with this talk:

  

She made protecting the ocean her life mission, and she really knows what she is talking about when she says we are facing a paradise lost, as in more than 6000 hours of diving in her career she saw oceans changing in front of her eyes.

We have the ability to change things, and now it's the time to change for the better!

Please donate to my campaign and let's help protect the oceans!

Other ways in which you can help the oceans:

  • eat less fish
  • avoid endangered fish
  • eat fish sustainably caught
  • reduce plastic litter, by reducing use of single-use-plastics, reuse and recycle
  • inspire others to take action!

PS: Please note that bank fees apply for bank transfers from outside the UK (up to 25%). Payments by Paypal are advised!
Payment processor fees = 3-5%
Indiegogo fees = 5%

story:
Short Summary

My chest would tighten while I struggled to breathe. Gasping for air, I would stare down at the murky East River in Williamsburg, Brooklyn wondering how it is that this world could have turned so toxic for me. I was living near one of the second largest oil spills ever - that had occurred over a decade earlier, yet I still struggled to breathe because of its remnants.

There are people like me all over the world and growing. Mysterious rashes, cancers, asthma, emphysema, pneumonia, and so much more .. all tied to our toxic addiction to fossil fuels.

Today, over seven million people die every year because of fossil fuels. And it is in all of our hands to change that. 

Call me a 'Tree Hugger'. I have been fortunate enough to grow up enjoying the beauties of nature. And as a mother, who has watched her once pristine home state of Florida become devastated by oil spills and environmental disasters, I now fear for for my child's future and for the coming years for all of us.

I can no longer sit and watch silently. So I have been focusing my efforts over the past years on creating easy access to solutions!

  • As founder of The Global Cooling Project, I have lobbied senators and congressmen on behalf of the environment with organizations such as The Citizens Climate Lobby and the American Sustainable Business Council. I've attended trainings and conference calls with Senator Bernie Sanders, Bill McCibbin, Bill Nye, OFA, The Union of Concerned Scientists and more. I have also been working diligently with my co-creator, Jeff Abugov (Roseanne, Two and a Half Men, Cheers, etc..) on the creation of an original series, 'Revolution Earth', that is aimed at making dramatically effective environmental action both easy and mainstream. 
  • Now I have a chance to work with one of my all time favorite heroes, Vice President Al Gore as part of the Climate Reality Leadership Corps. I am hoping to utilize this opportunity to catalyze necessary support for the production of 'Revolution Earth'. 
  • I am now asking for your help to get me there. We must take this to the next level. It is time for this production to move out of 'GREAT IDEA' mode and into production!!
  • The Climate Reality Leadership Corps should help provide me the training and the tools to become a better leader as well as increase my network for helping me to do so!

What We Need & What You Get

  • While my project ultimately needs much more than $1000, I have chosen to simplify the initial goal for the very next crucial stage, which is the training with Al Gore to become part of the Climate Reality Leadership Corps.
  • This will cover funds for transportation, housing and travel expenses in addition to essential account services, web hosting updates and presentation materials.
  • Offerings include Facebook Shout Outs, Full Color Mini-Posters, Special Thanks in our credits, Voice Over Demo Coaching and Direction, On Set Visits, an Appearance in our Pilot Episode, and a Personal Coffee Date and rundown of the incredible Al Gore Climate Reality Texas Training Experience. 

Additional Needs (Stretch Goals)

  • $2000 ~ We are in serious need of a computer upgrade. My MACBOOK Pro has lost processing speed which makes me incapable of editing my own material. Every stage of productivity is slowed down by these technical limitations. In kind donations in addition to meeting this fundraising goal will help amplify productivity in profound ways!
  • $3000 ~ ​Web-site re-design with professional social media integration, outreach and optimization.
  • $4000 and above ~ In addition to the above basics, we will need additional funds for future travel, membership fees, operation costs, production budget, development and packaging, organizational assistance and money for a clean energy outreach advertising campaign.  

The Impact

The need for action is urgent. And I need your help to keep this going. 

  • Climate Change is one of the greatest National Security Threats, and contributing to strengthening terrorist forces, according to the Pentagon.
  • Droughts, floods, fires, and extreme weather are on the rise, destabilizing regions throughout the world.
  • Carbon in the atmosphere is being absorbed by oceans, causing ocean acidification, killing sea life, and ultimately threatening the existence of life on earth.
  • While parents throughout the world are working hard to provide health and safety for their children, they are often times not informed about how their daily choices are threatening the lives of these children, and how they can begin to get off fossil fuels now. 
  • The transition to a clean and green economy is a necessity for the future of us all.
  • My goal is to help make that transition fun and easily accessible to busy parents as well as millennials through the use of entertainment. 
  • And though I would love to be able to move this forward without fundraising, I need funds to keep this going! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can kick fossil fuels today by visiting our Climate Store! Whether you rent or own, there can be viable clean energy options - WITH CASH BACK - for your home. Please check it out!
  • If you have skills or services that you would like to volunteer for our project (Web-design, web-site management, legal, social media marketing, graphic design, sustainable blogging, fundraising, organizational consultations and assistance are all greatly appreciated!) please contact me and let me know! We need to grow our team! 
  • Please share with your friends! We have a limited time to make this happen!
  • Please spread the word far and wide with IndieGogo's share tools!

Thank you!!

~ Aria

The Global Cooling Project is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Global Cooling Project must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

You can kick fossil fuels today by visiting our Climate Store! Whether you rent or own, there can be viable clean energy options - WITH CASH BACK - for your home. Please check it out!
